Martha & I went into the center to do some work there & Tucker came into the center, to get his sign & then to go outside to witness until 6pm. Well this afternoon he stayed & talked to Martha & I for about an half an hour.  He was about to leave when one of the drivers from the Taxi company came over to us in the All Purpose Room asking if he could use a chair of ours.  I said "yes" thinking that he was setting up for a meeting when all of a sudden he placed the chair on the floor & stood on it & then preceded to rip the Taxi's antenna right out of the ceiling & he ran outside with it in his hands.  We were all in shock & I then knocked on the door of the Taxi company & said to Alan that one of the drivers just came in & ripped the antenna right out of the ceiling.  He said "what"!  Then he said that he was going to call the bosses right away, which he did, because when I went to the outside door I saw that they were out there, in the parking lot, & the driver who had just stolen the antenna was arguing with them.  Unfortunately a little while later they had brought him back into the building & that's when the troubles just got started with me.  One of the bosses had asked me what had happened when the guy was right next to him.  I started to tell him what has just happened when the 'bad guy' said to me "mind your own business" with an evil eye pointed right to me.  I said back that it was my business because this was our pregnancy center  here to.  Then he said "mind your own business or I'll stab you". "What" I said, "what did you just say to me"?   Well, the first rule is that if anyone threatens our life then we must call the police to report it, for we won't have anyone threaten us, for no one has that right to put us in jeopardy. 

Then my second hell began, the police came.  You would think that they would be on my side, since I called them regarding the threat that was made to me but remember that we live in an imperfect world.  They  wounded me a second time with their not understanding of what had just taken place & their unbelief of what he had said to me.  The one police officer made some really strange comments that were unbelievable & quite inappropriate, to say the least.  I thought that I was in the 'Twilight Zone' (for those of you that know what I'm talking about)!!   It was the second nightmare of the day.  Martha went around sprinkling some Holy Salt around the rooms, for what was happening was demonic, to say the least.  Martha spoke to the one police officer to set him straight & I was left with the other, poor me.  Well I got no where fast & they finally left.  I decided not to make a citizens arrest for Martha didn't have in her hearing aid so she didn't hear him say that to me.  That was far, if she didn't then she didn't but I did.  So it was his word against my word, & that's that.  He latter apologized for what he said to me with the prompting of Martha who said that we should all just get along.  Blessed are the peace makers.  So he started to approach me & I backed off & accepted his apology from a far.  That'll do.  To say the least it was a very stressful time that was most unexpected, in the center. 

It was 6pm & the landlord came in, saying to me "I heard that you called the police".  I answered back to him "so you have a police radio Bernie".  No answer.  We had an appointment with the man, from Christian Rugs tonight, to pick out the color for the new rug in the new Great Room.  This turned out not as exciting as it should have because of all the commotion earlier on.  Needless to say I picked out a nice multi colored rug & the landlord worked out a payment plan.  It will be put in next Tuesday at 12 noon, just in time for our special Wednesday Mass, in the new Great Room, to celebrate the Blessed Mother's Birthday & the Focus Pregnancy Help Center's 5 years of service, in helping pregnant moms & their families, in the community.  Should be a great evening, can't wait!

Martha had to go, the stress was to much for her & I was left straightening out the center until it was done.  That's the job of the Director & that's fine with me.  Later on she told me that she had gone to church, to pray to God, before the Blessed Sacrament.  What a stressful day but a day of blessings too.  God always turns things around & makes it for good.  I just need to trust Him more, for He is forever faithful.    

 

Thursday, September 2, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

Outside on the sidewalk we had Martha, Bill, John, I & two other pro lifers, who were praying on the other side of the building, of Planned Parenthood today with Rose & Deanna inside the center.  Carole came by, which was a surprise because she doesn't usually come on Thursdays, but to our shock she said that her little grand daughter Payton, who was born 4 weeks ago at 1lb. 7ozs., was dying.  I gave her a hug & said that we are holding little Payton in our hearts & prayers.  This was a sad moment.  She told us that if she's not here next week she'll  be in Ohio where her daughter & Son in Law are.  Let's pray for a miracle dear Lord to let baby Payton to live & please bless the family with peace.  Thank you Lord Jesus. A few minutes later the cars began to go into Planned Parenthood to have their precious children be killed by the abortionist Rachael Phelps.  One baby is born & is trying to survive & the other babies are not born yet & are trying to survive.  Why are some mothers killing their own children, rather then loving & protecting them, like Carole's daughter is?  This scenario is really strange. 

I just then got a call & it was a client of ours needing some diapers & wipes & clothes for her baby.  I told her to come on in & we'll give her some.  Later after she arrived she told me that her grandmother had taken her baby & all his clothes, without her permission, when she was in her parents house, where she is now living.  She called the police & they told her to get an order of protection out on the grandmother & to press Kidnapping charges against her.  She & her mother got her son back the next day after the grandmother dropped the baby off at Day Care.  What was she thinking?  I gave her a bag of diapers & a box of wipes & she picked out some baby clothes, to hold her off, until she could get the clothes back from the grandmother.  She wasn't sure how that would happen.  So the Focus Center was there for her during this difficult time & I was glad of that.  I gave her some special personal items like a basket full of soaps, candles & lotions for herself that made her very happy.  My heart melted when she gave me a big smile back & a hug with a 'thank you' besides.  "My pleasure" I said back.  She, like all our clients & their children, are so dear to our hearts & are in our prayers too.  Off she & her precious baby were off to catch the bus downtown.  Keep in touch I said to her as she was leaving.  She turned around & said that she would.  That made me very happy.

I was now back to the front lines & the pro lifers there were praying & sidewalk counseling.  A few minutes later Deanna arrived to work in the center.  I followed her into the center & then gave her some instructions.  I needed some letters to be written & some other small projects for her to do.  I was sad because this was her last day with us for she's going back to England to do her mission work there.  We'll all miss her that's for sure & she's been such a blessing to us over the past 4 weeks that she's been with us.   The very best to dear Deanna.  She said that she'll be back in the US at Christmas time & we'll see her then again :) 
 

When I went back outside I brought some bottled water from the refrig, for it was a very hot day.  The team was glad to see me that's for sure.  Just then the cars were coming out of Planned Parenthood & the girls had there heads down & the boyfriends were shouting at us.  They had their precious baby be killed here today & now are tormented by our graphic signs, that was suppose to save their baby's life, but they wouldn't listen & they went through with it, paying the assassin to kill their God given child.  How Evil, how Inhumane & how Insane.  My heart drops when they come out of Planned Parenthood & of course when they go in too.  Lives, through the grace of God, have been saved but many lives have been lost, which is so difficult for  Martha & I especially because we are usually the ones that are there when they come out 'looking like death warmed over' slumped either in the fron or back seat of the car, the rest of the team are usually gone at that time.  Maybe we should be gone too, for it's so hard for Martha & I?   We only hope & pray that they will ask God to forgive them for this sin of 'murder' (which abortion is) with a sincere heart of repentance & God will forgive them, otherwise they are putting their souls in jeopardy, of going to Hell forever, for this Mortal Sin. 

The doorbell rang & I went to open the door.  I saw three young girls, standing there.  I asked if I could help them & two of the girls said that they were here for a pregnancy test, the third girl was pregnant.  I lead them to the Rose Room for testing & counseling.  I asked the two girls to fill out an Intake Sheet.  The one girl said "is this Planned Parenthood"?  I looked at her in surprise & said "no it's not, they kill babies at Planned Parenthood, we're a pregnancy center where we save lives".  The first test was done - negative, the second test was done - negative.  I started to teach about self respect & abstinence.  These girls were very young but not as young as the pregnant little girl for she was 14 years old.  It made me very upset that a boy took advantage of her at 14.  Where was the mother who works in the church??  Don't get me wrong I'm so glad that she's having her baby & not killing her child, that's not the point. That's a given, for when you're pregnant, you stay that way, no matter what your situation is  'YOU NEVER KILL YOUR BABY'!!  The questions are: why do these girls have no boundaries & why don't they know how to say "NO" & why are they getting themselves in these situations, with these inconsiderate, sex minded guys, that are using them for their pleasure.  I want to make the bad things that happen to them go away but I can't.  That's why prayer & education is so important along with our love & guidance, that we give them at the Focus Center, is so important, for a 'new beginning'.  Where are their mothers & fathers??  Where are the Preachers & Teachers, in the Community??  They all seem to know where Planned Parenthood is!!  That EVIL place that kills babies & ruins peoples lives.  What is wrong with this picture?  When I found out that she was 14 I asked her to fill out an Intake Sheet so that Suzanne can call her, at times, to see how she is doing & if she needs anything.  I also gave her some helpful brochures to take with her & told her to call them to get some assistance during her pregnancy & afterwards.  We'll be there for her too.  I also gave her the Growth & Development DVD & the movie Bella (which is about adoption) & some adoption informational brochures too.  I gave her some baby T shirts & a baby blanket & said for  her to come back when she knows if she's going to have a boy or a girl.  She was happy to hear that.  She seemed in 'good spirits' with her pregnancy & that's good because emotions effect the baby, in the womb.  All three girls said thank you & good bye & off they went, into the cruel world.  I was thinking that her two friends, probably want to get pregnant to, so that all three are pregnant at the same time, for they are best friends.  Like I said earlier, where are the parents, etc.?  Doesn't anyone care?  We do, we're a start.........
 
Pastor Jane't had just arrived, for her teaching course, about the Bible.  I didn't get there until late & Martha had gone to get a pizza for our supper.  We all ate at the table & Jane't played some beautiful music to relax us.  I had just finished the cream of broccoli pizza when the doorbell rang & it was Jennifer, from the Catholic Courier, for an interview that she called me about the day before.  She was doing an article about how some people got started in their ministries & what makes them keep on going after all these years later & through difficult times.  It's an easy couple of questions to answer for it's  'God'.   He chose me for this ministry & keeps me going forward.  I interviewed with her for two hours & fifteen minutes.  I got a little long winded talking about myself but I did give 'God the Glory' as I witnessed to her highlights of my 25 years in the pro life movement, on the streets & in the center.  She had to go, to pack her suitcase, for her & her husband were heading to Rome the next day to see the Pope & to take a journalism class.  I asked her if I could fit in her suitcase.  She laughed, maybe she thought I was kidding?  Have a safe & blessed trip Jennifer.  The article will be in the October's Catholic Courier. 
 
It was 8:15pm now & Martha & Jane't had gone home. John had left earlier to go to a meeting on East Ave. around 7pm & had just returned from the meeting.  He was now waiting for a ride back to my apartment to get his car to go  home to Bristol.  I wasn't ready so he did some work on the computer for me.  We left around 9:30pm tonight.  A long day but a blessed one.
 
The next day I came back to the center to paint the door, to the taxi company, gray.  It took a lot of time & then I went to the Church Rectory get the DVD's that we pass out to our clients, from Father, who burns them for me.  Thanks Father, you're doing a great job in saving lives.  These are the Growth & Development & Maafa 21: Black Genocide in the 21st. Century DVD's, a very helpful teaching aid that we give away to save babies lives & to educate. 
Check out: http://www.ct4women.com/pc_development.html & http://www.lifedynamics.com/Abortion_Information/Pro-life_Product/maafa.cfm.
 

I then received the Sacrament, of the Anointing of the Sick, from Fr. Leone, my Spiritual Director. He's also the Focus Pregnancy Help Center's Spiritual Director.  He prayed for me & I then received Holy Communion, which is the real Body, Blood, Soul & Divinity of Jesus Christ.  Check out: http://www.beginningcatholic.com/communion.html & http://catholicism.about.com/od/thesacraments/The_Sacraments-of_the_Catholic_Church_The_Seven_Sacraments.htm.

Thanks Fr. Leone, you & Fr.C. & Fr.P. are a blessing to me & to the work of the Focus Center.  God bless you all.  

   

Tuesday, September 7, 2010 at Planned Parenthood

I couldn't get out to the front lines for I was so busy in the center.  The street ministry was well attended by Martha, Mary S., Donna & Carole ( I was so glad to see her & she said that little baby Peyton was holding on) thank you Lord.  Do I need to say more.  The sidewalk ministry was in good hands that for sure.  I'm dispensable & it's only through the grace of God that I can do anything.  Sandy & Rose were in the center & the men came to put in our new rug in the Great Room, looking good!!  We all were so excited at the results even the landlord Bernie was on hand to pay the men.  God has touched his heart that's for sure.  A year ago he wanted us to leave, well things can really change in a year's time, through the grace of God.  Love ya Bernie.  I gave instruction to the girls, we just had our shelf repaired in the Material Aid Room & the shelves are now secured by wood, so I asked the girls if they could cover it with contact paper, they both did a great job. Newly donated baby clothes were put away into the Material Aid Room & literature was folded up & new Truth packets were made up.  

I then quickly ate my chicken sandwich before I headed outside to the War Zone!  Just then the doorbell rang & it was Martha bringing a young girl into the center. She indicated that she was going to Planned Parenthood, thinking about having an abortion, so I asked her to fill out the Intake Sheet & then preceded to round up as much information that would be helpful to her as I could.  I even gave her a DVD on Growth & Development & Maafia:21.  She took the little rubberized baby at 12 weeks & I also showed her the model of the baby, in her womb, at 9 weeks. I could tell that she was amazed. I brought her into the office to see the pictures I have on the wall of an abortion, for educational purposes.  She looked shocked & that was good. 

  

 Wednesday, September 8, 2010 at the Focus Center

We celebrated the Mass, in our new beautiful Great Room, on the Birthday of the Blessed Mother & our 5th. year as a Pregnancy Center.  Our celebrant was Fr.Tony, who gave a fantastic homily, & our '40 Days for Life' coordinator Rick, gave his testimony of his coming back to the Catholic Church.  It was a powerful witness to the love of God & the Truth. There was much sharing & a great buffet too.  Thanks to all that came, all 27 of you, you are a blessing to us, at Focus.  Also many other people wanted to come but it didn't work out for them tonight but hopefully next month, when we have another Mass, in the Great Room.  The celebrant will be Fr.Brian Carpenter, who is the newest ordained priest, here in Rochester, NY.. 

Thursday, September 9, 2010 front of Planned Parenthood

After Mass today I spoke to my police friend, Officer Mike, regarding the episode last Wednesday at the center with the out of control taxi driver.  I told him about the police responses that were inappropriate & he said that he will speak to them.  I said "thank you" for this officer is a true officer & I wish more officers would be like him.  When I arrived at the center Martha was just getting out of her leader car, for her car is in the shop.  Jerry came over to help set up on the sidewalk.  I was in & out of the center until Suzanne, our Thursday counselor, came.  Rose had come in now to the center & I gave her some instruction for the afternoon.  When I came back out Martha told me that a car came out of Planned Parenthood & the passenger was slumped in the front seat & she was showing her wrist band, for she had an abortion this morning & was coming out now.  It was very hard for Martha to see & for me to hear.  A blue truck had dropped off two girls into the killing mill.  Is said to him as he was leaving, "what are you doing dropping off these two girls"?  He rolled up his window as he drove passed us, on the sidewalk.

A red van was turning around in the veterinary, who is across the street form Planned Parenthood & I thought that it was going to go up the street but it went right into Planned Parenthood's driveway.  I was shocked to see his whole family get out of the van & walk into Planned Parenthood, him & his wife & children.  I called out to him but he wouldn't listen.  My heart ached to see that.  Then three young girls were walking into Planned Parenthood & I called to them one of the girls seemed to want to come over to Martha & I but they all went into Planned Parenthood instead.  Again your heart aches at al of this.  Nasty people were driving by & a kid on a bicycle rode passed Martha, for I was in the center when this happened, he said to her as he rode by "why don't you just go away".  She replied "why don't you ride your bicycle in the street rather than on the sidewalk"?  What a smart allelic!  I was quickly eating my turkey sandwich that Rose had made & after the last bite I saw that the three girls were coming out of Planned Parenthood & were on the sidewalk next to us.  One of the girls said "I heard what you were saying & I wanted to come over to see if you could help me"?  "Oh yes" Martha replied.  I said that there was a counselor in the center right now so come follow me I said.  They seemed to be some hesitancy but thank God they started to follow me to the center.  I took a drink of my ice tea before I started walking & I crunched down on something so I took it out of my mouth only to see that it was a bee.  Ick!!  I spit it out onto the sidewalk & teased the girls saying "I almost swallowed a bee".  I lead them into the center & introduced them to Suzanne, who now took over in helping the girls, for they are now in good hands.  I handed them all a Truth packet & a rubberized 12 week old baby & they said "thank you" & I then left them with Suzanne & I went back outside to be with Martha who was with Jerry who was praying on the brick side of Planned Parenthood. 

Martha & I saw a young woman with a suitcase on wheels coming down the sidewalk, we always get ready when we see someone coming up the sidewalk, with the Truth packet in hand to pass out to them.  When this young woman came near us she immediately said to us "you both look familiar, where have I've  seen you before"?  We both said "was it here"?  She said "no, I never had no reason to go to Planned Parenthood, what church do you go to"?  I said "Our Lady of Victory, down the street".  Martha said "I attend St. Theodore's in Gates".  "No" she said "not at these churches, where do I know you both from"?   I replied that the only place I can think of was here on the sidewalk.  "Well maybe" she said back. "Oh", I replied.  She quickly answered back "oh no I've never had an abortion".  "I have 3 children & I'm just divorced".  I'm on my way to the Jennifer House, (which is a prison outreach program that works with men & woman & helps them to reenter the community following their release).  It's sponsored by Spititus Christi, which does good community work in helping people but there Theology is way off.  They are excommunicated from the Catholic Church, but they refer themselves as Catholics.  This is on there web site "We are an inclusive Catholic Church where all are welcome".  No you are not!!  They are only kidding themselves.  The so called pastor Mary Ramerman, thinks that she's a priest.  No again!  It's only in her head.  Woman can't be priests because Jesus was a man & so were the Apostales.  In the Church women play many important roles but one of them is not as a priest.  Sorry Mary!  Please repent & all those who work & attend Spiritus Christi.  I enven have a friend that attends there & it breaks my heart. He did ask me for my prayers though.  They don't follow the Truth.  They are everything to everyone thus compromising the Truth to those that need it for their salvation & healing.  Enough of this. Well, our little lady, that stopped & talked with us, took a Rosary & our Truth packet & gave us a nice warm smile & said "good bye" & off she went down the street.  She said that she had taken the wrong bus & got off at the wrong bus stop but the good Lord had other plans for her today.  She was a gift to both Martha & I.  What a blessing to have meet her & we were touched by this encounter with her.  We wish her well & we will keep her in our hearts & prayers that she can get better soon & go back with her children.  She's a Catholic & I suggested for her to go to the Sacrament of Confession & to attend Mass every Sunday & of course to say her Rosary.  Mother Mary will draw her closer to Jesus, her son, for hope & healing in her 'new life'.  Hope to see her again someday. 

I saw a car drive by & it was Sergeant Bob.  He saw Martha & I & did a U Turn & came over to us for a visit.  I said "Hi Sergeant Bob, how are you doing"?  He said that he had just retired from the police force after 37 years of service.  "It's about time, don't you think, he said"?  I agreed, would I argue with a Sergeant!!  He did say that he was still working part time for the Federal Marshals office.  I forgot to ask him about how Planned Parenthood harassed us with the inaccurate yellow buffer zone for about 2 weeks with the landscaper on our tail.  So far we're not having any problems with him.  But in the future, if he starts up again, I know who to call, I do have his number.  He asked me how I was doing & I told him about the pregnancy center's advancement.  He them looked at me sternly & said "I asked how YOU were doing"!.  Oh me, how am I doing, terrible I confessed.  "What's wrong", he said.  "Oh I have  Fibromyalgia http://www.fmaware.org/site/PageServer, besides other things going on, to many to mention".  He said "is this an Autoimmune condition?".  "I guess so", I replied  "What are you doing for it", he said?  I said "nothing, I don't know what to do for it, I can't take pain pills all my life, I'll ruin my liver, so I just offer my pain & discomfort up to the Lord to use it to save lives & souls, including my own, & He gives me the grace to endure it".  "I'll be fine" I said, I receive the Sacrament of the Sick every month, that's my medicine & try to go to daily Mass & receive the Holy Eucharist, that's my medicine.  Plus read the Bible & say the Rosary, that's my medicine too.  He's Catholic, so I know that he understood, what I was saying.  "Well it was good seeing you ladies & remember to be careful out here".  "Yes Sergeant Bob we will, bye for now & it was good seeing you too.  I remember once he told me that he was scared that a car would someday jump the curb & hit us, so far so good Sergeant Bob, thanks for caring.  We go way back, about 14 years back.  Glad that he retired & he will be able to spend more time with family & to relax.   

I went I get the sidewalk chalk to put down, on the sidewalk, the Pregnancy Help number which is: 800-395-Help, 24x7.  I finished on the side where Martha & I were standing, now I was going over to the other side of Planned Parenthood, to put down the same message there. We had a girl call that number & she received the right kind help that she needed. Yeah!!  Just as I was finished I saw Donna drive by.  I hollered over to her & she did a U Turn, the second of the day, & she stopped where I was standing.  She said that she was going to drop off Veronica over to the music school & she'll be right back.  She also said that she had hurt her back & was very uncomfortable. "I'm sorry to hear that, my dear".   I then said that Martha & I were heading into the center & we'll all watch 'Blood Money', a DVD about the abortion industry, together.  "Okay" she said, I'll be right back & I can stay about an hour."  "Great", I said, "I'll see you in a little while".  Off she goes.  I walked over to where Martha was & we brought all the things back into the center to put away.  I said to our volunteer, "put down what you're doing & come watch the DVD 'Blood Money' with us, when Donna comes in, for I want you to see it too".  When Donna arrived, with her 3 out of 6 children, we all went into the Rose Room, to watch the DVD.  Her 2 boys were in the Meeting Room playing & Donna was holding little wiggly, Hannah.  This 'Blood Money' was heart retching, to listen to, to say the least.  Just then, our sweet volunteer burst out in uncontrollable tears & told us her stories.  When she was 12 years old she was rapped.  She didn't know that she was pregnant until she was 8 months along.  Her mother then drove her to a place on Lattimore, next to Strong Hospital, & made her have an abortion.  The mother paid lots of money for the abortion. When she woke up she asked about her baby, not really knowing what  had just happened. When she found out that she wasn't pregnant anymore she said that she hated her mother from that moment on.  When her mother, on her death bed, asked her to forgive her for what she did, she replied "no, I only hope that my baby, that you killed, will forgive you".  She was crying like a baby.  I got up & gave her a hug & a Kleenex.  My heart went out to her for the loss, of her baby, & for the betrayal, of her own mother.  She said that her own mother wanted to abort her but was talked out of it & that her grandmother raised her, for most of her life.  What loss, pain & rejection.  My heart went out to her, for I related.  Then she said that she had some children & then had her Fallopian tubes tied.  A couple of years later she thought that she could be pregnant so she went to Strong Hospital to get a pregnancy test.  It was positive.  The female doctor told her that she had an infection & that she needed to take 'this pill'.  She told her that she would when se got home. The doctor said "no, you need to take it now".  So she did & off she went home thinking that she had an infection & all will be well.  No so, not so.  The next day she started to bleed & all 'this stuff' came out of me, she said.  Then she new that she was pregnant & that the doctor had given her an abortion pill.  She was devastated to say the least & heart broken again.  She didn't believe in abortion & never wanted one.  This was the second time she was deceived & betrayed by a higher authority, first a mother & now a doctor.  How sad, my heart went out to her.  This sharing was hitting close to home for me too.  Not the same story but the betrayal of the higher authority, a mother, a nurse instructor & two doctors.  I spoke with her for awhile & then we continued to watch the intense DVD.  After it was over I realized how important it was, for it had triggered, our sweet volunteer & myself, from past traumas.  Martha & Donna were also effected by this video.  A must see for all pro lifers.  I thought of showing it at Focus, during the '40 Days for Life' campaign.  The DVD is short 2 hours, it goes quickly, but it's soooo important to watch!!  The more knowledge we receive the more that we can educate others. She asked to watch the very graphic video 'Hard Truth'.   WARNING: GRAPHIC PICTURES: http://www.abortiontv.com/Movies/viewliveabortions.htm & http://www.prolife.com/.  I asked her if she really wanted to see an abortion, I wouldn't even watch it.  She said "yes".  I went to get the DVD, for her to take home to watch it with her family, as requested by her.  I hope that I made the right decision, for I don't want to wound her any further, for she's been through so much already & she's such a sweet woman.  She's such a blessing to us at Focus.  Thank you Jesus!! 

 

Monday, September 13, 2010 infront of Planned Parenthood

How do I compute this one.  We have a great team who are on the front lines & in the Focus Center on Mondays evenings from 3-6pm.  This evening, I spoke with the counselor to see if everything went well she told me this story of what happened on Monday evening at Focus.  The sidewalk counselor rought a young woman into the center, who had just come out of Planned Parenthood.  Pat, the Monday evening counselor, greeted her at the door & brought her into the Rose Room for counseling & to fill out the Intake Sheet, so that we can better serve our clients needs.  The story was that this client was pregnant, she just found out at Planned Parenthood, & has 3 other children at home.  She isn't married & it doesn't seem likely that marriage, to the father of her children, will happen.  She has had one abortion in the past & said that she will never do that again, ever.  After her abortion she started to cry & the so called nurse at Planned Parenthood said "maybe this wasn't the right decision for you after all".  Now what then, the damage is already done??  Rachael Phelps just killed her precious baby & the so called nurse said "oh, I think you made a mistake prehaps".  What about before the fact dearie & why does Planned Parenthood kill children anyway??  Well the shocker was, after she was told today that she was pregnant, the so called nurse said to her "why don't you come back tomorrow to terminate".  The poor girl almost vomited on the floor, so out of the Killing Mill she goes, all alone, until she sees the sidewalk counselor who now changes her life.  Praise God!!  He lead her into the Focus Center & Pat, the counselor, gets the whole story.  She gives her some adoption information & calls Bethany Christian Services & the client talks to the Social Worker there for over a half an hour.  She then goes into the Material Aid Room & gets a whole lot of things for her children & the sidewalk counselor brings her home.  How can anyone NOT believe in God??  I was said that she told Pat that when she went for the abortion there was no one there in front of Planned Parenthood so in she went to do the awful deed & when she came out in the early afternoon there we were, on the front lines.  She said that she saw our graphic sign of the 10 week old aborted baby & she knew that was her baby, that she just paid the abortionist Rachael Phelps to murder, in cold blood.  Her pain & grief & shame & sorrow was still evident as of today, I was told.  The client will be coming back on Wednesday to pick up some older children clothes, for her 11 year old son, that Pat will be bringing in. When I see her on Wednesday, I'll talk to her about some post abortion care, so she can receive forgiveness, help & healing, from God & her precious baby, that was killed that awful abortion day.  My heart is very sad that we can't get anyone to be out in front of Planned Parenthood on Tuesday & Thursday mornings.  I will say that Pat & Bill do pray, the Rosary, for an hour on Tuesday mornings, so it seemed that this woman came after they left, to have the abortion.  We should have pro lifers there, in front of Planned Parenthood, every day & all day long too.  What's wrong with this picture?  Why are good people so docile when it comes to abortion, which effects us all, in this country?  Abortion is the murdering of an innocent human being, that is totally dependent on the mother, in the womb, where it should be safe.  This cancer, of abortion, has hit home to all of us, either directly or indirectly.  When will this Evil end & when will people be more pro active, in the cause??

 

Tuesday, September 14, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
 
When I arrived at the center after Mass I started to bring things in from my car & to put some things away.  Sandy just came in & helped me bring the winter baby & children clothes, that I had washed at home, for the center.  Nice & fresh & clean.  I was complaining about the  taxi guys that had a meeting in the All Purpose Room & didn't put things away.  Just then I saw a young girl come walking down the hallway.  I said "are you hear to get some things in the Material Aid Room"?  "Yes", she said so I asked Sandy to go in the room to help her.  I said "you look familiar, I remember you came in with your 2 sisters on Friday".  She said "yes, I thought that I was going to have a boy but just found out, through ultrasound, that she's a girl"  "Wow " I said "that's great".  Your baby is due in January so take what you need now & you can come back another time to & get more things for you baby.  I remembered that she told me on Friday that she had an abortion, in the past, but never would do that again.  I went into the office to get some post abortion brochures to give to her for help & healing.  I told her that I had put some information in her bag.  She thanked me & off she went & happy person.  Our post abortive girls are hurting & we want to be there to help them to heal & to get right with God, who they greatly offended, by having an abortion.  God is loving & merciful & quick to forgive. 
 
Rose just came in & I asked her to make a sandwich for Martha & I for our lunch, for I was about to faint.  I need to eat a better breakfast, so I can go strong in the afternoons, here on the front lines.  Just then Mary S. came into the center to get some signs to go out to the sidewalk.  I said "come follow me into our new Great Room".  She was so impressed.  She said that she would be gone for the next 2 weeks for her & her husband of 25 years are going to California to celebrate.  We will miss you Mary, have a great time celebrating your 25th. Wedding Anniversary.  You both deserve a great time.  :)
 
Just then Carole came in with a huge crucifix.  It was beautiful & heart aching.  I quickly went into our new Great Room & took 2 pictures that I had put up on the wall on Saturday & then put up the Crucifix.  We want to give God the Glory & Praise, for what He has done for us. Carole said that little Peyton is holding her own & will be going to visit her daughter in Ohio for her Baby Shower.  Great Carole that will be nice for your daughter & for the rest of the family. 
 
I was in & out of the center, all afternoon.  Five moms & I dad were helped in the Material Aid Room as Rose was putting out the winter clothes & putting away the summer clothes.  Very busy day, like always.  I saw a young man walking down the sidewalk with a baby in the stroller.  I called over to him & told him that we had 'free' baby & children clothes in the center.  He crossed the street with his baby & there he goes into the center.  Martha went in to assist him & when she came back out she said that he told her that he has had custody, of his daughter, from day 1.  When he came back out & as he passed us by, on the sidewalk, I looked right in his eyes to thank him for a great job that he's doing for his daughter & if he needed anything else, to come on back.  He smiled & said "thank you".  As he walked by us we saw that his shirt had a huge cross on the back of his shirt. He was so happy & proud of his bundle of joy. What an experience, I feel like crying. 
 
A van just drove into Planned Parenthood & when the van door opened out came a child, a boy around 5 or 6 years of age.  It just breaks my heart to see children there at Planned Parenthood, that the parent or parents bring their child or children, to such an evil place. The mother brought him into Planned Parenthood & about 15 minutes later they came back out.  As he was going into the van I hollered over to him saying "I'm sorry, sweet boy, that you are here".  He answered me back in such a sweet child like voice saying "that's okay".  I almost melted & cried too.  He was consoling me, that he was there.  Maybe he picked up on my worry for him.  My heart was touched.  He sounded like an angel from above.  Maybe, that was God's way to say that this situation was not to worry about, for the abortionist had left about 10 minutes earlier.  What an I to do Lord??  You have my heart & life & tears. 
 
A girl had walked by us & I asked her if she needed any baby or children clothes.  She said "no".  Then Martha said that we give out free pregnancy tests.  She turned around & said "okay I would like to have one please".  So Martha brought her into the center for a pregnancy test, which was negative & while she was there she went into the Material Aid Room to get some things for her 9 year old son. 
 
I was looking forward to seeing the carpet man today to pick out the carpet colors in both the hallway & the All Purpose Room.  When he arrived I called out landlord & he said that he was a few minutes away.  Martha & I looked at the carpet colors & we picked out 2 beautiful shades  for both rooms.  It will be done on Monday & it will look great Yeah!!!  Thank you Lord for I've been waiting for 5 long years to change the carpet in the center's hallway & the main room, which we do share with our friends, in the Taxi company.  It will look beautiful & it will be ready for the '40 Days for Life' 'Kick Off Rally', on Tuesday September 21st. at the Focus Center.  I just found out today that our landlord Bernie his wife runs a Day Care Center in their home.  What a shock to say the least.  He also rents out apartments.  Learn something new every day.. 
 
Bob came into the center with 100 handmade Rosaries, that were blessed.  We put a Rosary in all of our Truth packets & we try to hand them out to the people walking on the sidewalk too.  They were beautiful  He also wanted to make a donation, to the center, in Memory of a friend of ours Dr. Barb, whose mother who just died.  My heart was touched again today. 
 
A girl & guy came out of Planned Parenthood.  I was on the other side of the street at that time so I offered them the Truth packet.  The girl wanted no part of it but the young man took it from me.  The cars driving by were vicious, or at least some of them.  They should keep their fingers to themselves.  Like Carole says "I hope that it drops off".  I hope that this is Christian.  I know what she means. 
 
We saw that a large group of young kids were coming down the street from the school up the street.  We were there to educate as they walked by.  Then the teachers came by saying to the students "just keep on walking".  Okay nice teacher, we are your friends, too. I feel that these kids will never forget what they saw today & maybe it will even save a life, in the future.  The mind always remembers.  
 
The abortionist was standing there, by her dark blue car, talking to another woman with short hair.  This made me sick.  I called over to her asking her to repent & that there will be justice someday for all the people that she's killed.  I also said that because she had an hysterectomy at 23 that she wants all women not to have children.  I went on & on, for it's so horrible to see someone that you know that kills children & acts like it's no big deal.  What's wrong with her?  Why is she killing children?  Earlier this afternoon a car came out of Planned Parenthood & the young girl, on the passenger side, was crying.  Her mother was driving the 'get away' car.  I hollered to the young girl & said "I hope someday you can forgive your mother for what she did to you here today".  This is the legacy of Rachael Phelps, who destroys life in the womb & life outside of the womb. 
 
I was in the center & Carole came in saying that she had to go & that a woman was out on the sidewalk with Martha & she wants to join our efforts there.  I knew exactly who Carole was talking about.  Sheila called me about 4 weeks ago saying that when she can she'd like to join us on the front lines.  I went outside to meet her.  She's a very nice woman will be joining Martha & I on Wednesday afternoons.  Welcome Sheila..  
 
Martha & I were now in the center & getting ready for supper. I brought in a baked chicken & Cole slaw & a green salad & stuffed potato skins with bacon & cheese.  Yummy!   Martha, after supper, was going to her Parish to speak about the '40 Days for Life" campaign & we were having our last meeting tonight, at Focus, to discuss the '40 Days for Life' campaign.  The doorbell started to ring.  We had 6 people at the meeting.  All of them were wearing 'I just Voted' stickers on.  "Where is yours Mary" said Donna.  I said that I was very busy in the center so go into the office to see what a mess it is.  "No excuse, you need to go vote tonight".  Then here comes Anne, who says the same thing to me & then another person says the same thing too, I'm surrounded.  Well, after the meeting they all helped me in the office, to get some things done, so now I was 'free' to go vote.  I was glad that I did, for it is my duty,  & I was so happy that my candidates won the Primary!!!    I was given two 'I just Voted' stickers,  ya ya!  Thanks guys for I needed a kick in the butt & you were all there to give it to me & that's what friends are for.

 

Wednesday, September 15, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

 Martha & I arrived after Mass today.  I ran into Kathy after Mass & asked her to come to the center to see the new room.  She came to see the new Great Room & was impressed with the size & the decorations.  I'll miss Kathy & her husband Aaron, for they're moving to Buffalo, in October, to start a new life because Arron got a job ther.  They are such a nice couple & Arron & his friend Joe painted our general meeting room, a gorgeous green, about 4 years ago.  Thanks guys!  When I was speaking to Kathy, Martha came in & joined us, then a client came in to get some things in the Material Aid Room. I said good bye to Kathy & then went to assist our client in the clothing room.   After she went out of the center I said to Martha "please go to see if the abortionist is here today".  She went outside with the signs & the literature box & the mega phone to go into battle.  I asked her if it was okay with her I'd like to work in the office to catch up on some things & then I'll come right out to be with her on the front lines.  She agreed that was okay.  So I stayed in the center while Martha was outside, by herself, which we don't like to do.  I did a couple of things in the office to play 'catch up' & then went outside to be with Martha.  I looked in the parking lot & I didn't see the abortionist there, so I said "Martha, the abortionist isn't here"!  Just then the abortionist, Rachael Phelps drives out of the parking lot.  I hollered to her to stop killing little babies & to repent.  She just drove off acting like nothing she's doing is wrong.  Oh Lord help us!! 

 
A car with two women & 2 young children were driving out of the parking lot.  We called to them offering them free baby clothes.  The car pulled next to us & asked where we do we get the 'free' clothes.  I said "come follow me", which they did into the center.  As I brought them into the Material Aid Room & began speaking with them & one thing lead to another.  A few minutes later the one girl asked for a pregnancy test.  I said "why don't you follow me into the Rose Room, for the test" which she did.  I gave her instructions & then asked her questions for the Intake Sheet.  I found out that she was on Implanon, here we go again.  This, like all contraceptives are, DANGEROUS & THEY ACT AS AN ABORTIFICANT.  Poor girl, I instructed her about this drug & gave her the brochure about it.  I also counseled her about abstinence, for she said that she new the Lord, or did she?  I finally told her that her pregnancy test was negative after she asked me what the results were, for I had looked at the results but failed to tell her, until she asked.  She was in a hurry & off she went with her Truth packet & some new information in her heart & mind.  The very best to you dear one. 
 
As I was about to return to the front lines the doorbell rang.  It was a mom, with one child & who has nothing & is due in November, with baby number two.  I told her that I was trying to reach her but I couldn't get through.  She said that she just had put some minutes on her cell phone.  I told her that we just got some more baby boy clothes & for her to shop around.  I said to the young woman with her "can I help you".  She said that she was with her friend & that she needed diapers & wipes for her 2 year old twins, a boy & a girl.  I went into the office, where we have the supply of diapers, under the literature tables.  I found a couple of bags to give to the moms along with some baby wipes.  They were both very happy.  They picked out some nice things in the Material Aid Room for their children.  I was ready to be with Martha, on the front lines, when the doorbell rang again.  There at the door was  a young woman, & a cute little boy & an older man with long hair & a beard.  "May I help you" I asked.  "Yes, I need some clothes & diapers for my son".  "Come on in" I said & I lead them into the Material Aid Room for some shopping.  It turned out that she was a referral client.  She needed more assistance than we could give her but we had lots of referrals for her to call regarding 'Food Pantries' & free furniture, for her apartment, etc..  I said all you have to do is make some phone calls & here is a referral from the Focus Center, in case any organization needs one, then you'll have this to give to them to receive their assistance.  She & her father were very happy, to say the least.  I was happy to be able to help this nice mom & her son.  God bless this family. 
 
I went out to the front lines where Martha was by herself, saying her Rosary, God love her.  I discerned the situation & said to her "lets go inside now for the abortionist isn't here & there isn't many cars, thank God & it's a mess inside the office & I'm hungry & ready to faint".  She said "okay" & we gathered everything on the sidewalk to take with us back to the center.  I stayed while Martha was putting thing away & out come a car, from the Planned Parenthood, parking lot.  I called over to her & offered her a Truth packet.  She said that she didn't believe in abortions & said that Planned Parenthood does.  She took the packet & smiled at me & said "thank you".  "No" I said "thank you".  As I was finished with this open minded woman of faith another car drove into the parking lot with a Rosary on her mirror.  When she got out of the car & lit into her about the hypocrisy of having a Rosary on her car mirror & going into Planned Parenthood.  When she drove out, about a few minutes later, for she went into the Administration Building entrance, she saw the graphic picture of Malachi & I said that they kill children here every day.  I saw that her face was effected, when she went face to face, with this aborted baby.  I felt that she had a heart & I pray that she'll never come back here again, through the grace of God. 
 
I made a chicken sandwich , for Martha & I, & I heated up the last two potato skins, for our lunch.  We were about to sit down together to eat lunch when the doorbell rang.  Martha got up to answer the door, it was a pregnant young lady who was due with a baby girl in January.  She asked for some diapers so I went into the office to get her some newborn diapers & Martha stayed with her to assist her with some newborn clothes for her little one's arrival in December.   I went back into the gathering room & ate my lunch alone.  After this mom left Martha came into, the room, to eat her chicken sandwich lunch.  After lunch we went into the office to put diapers into a plastic bag of 12 diapers each, so that we can service our moms for a short time, until they can get the assistance they need for long term.   Just then Martha said "what time is it"?  I said that it was 4:15.  "Oh no" she said, I'm suppose to be at an InService meeting at 4:30 on Lake Ave..  As she rushed out of the center, I said to her "please be careful, okay Martha".   She turned around & said that she would.  "See you tomorrow", I hollered to her.  Wow, she just lost sight of the time, maybe I kept her to busy in the center. 
 
I went back to my messy desk & sorted out some papers & made some phone calls, etc.  Just then the doorbell rang & it was Pat, our Monday afternoon counselor, dropping off some clothes for a client she saw & spent much time with on Monday.  I called the client & she was happy & said that she'll drop by on Thursday to get the clothes that Pat dropped off for her 11 year old son.  Thanks Pat, how thoughtful of you. 
 
Tucker came in at 4pm to witness outside in front of Planned Parenthood. He's been doing this for 12 years now every Wednesday, from 4-6pm.  He & I started the Focus Pregnancy Help Center in 2005 together.  He's faithful. 
 
The doorbell rang & it was Mike.  He answered my email requesting assistance in the Material Aid Room sorting out baby & children clothes & putting away the summer clothes & putting out the winter clothes.  He answered my call.  He gave me a hug & I showed him around.  He said that he'd like to put up some shelves in the office to better organize our room, free of charge.  Wow, what a surprise!  Thank you Lord of all your surprise, for there was another 2 surprises waiting for me in the next hour.  As we were working in the Material Aid Room putting the winter clothes in the baskets the doorbell rang.  I went to the door to greet a young woman asking for some baby clothes for her young son.  I said sure come on in & I lead her in to the clothing room.  I introduced her to Mike & gave her a bag to start shopping.  She was delighted.  She told me that a woman called out to her as she was walking her young son down the sidewalk & she called over to her that we had a stroller for her & Martha lead her into the center to receive the stroller. This incident touched her heart.  She came back to the center for more clothes for her son for the nice lady said that if I needed anything else just come on back.  I said that Martha had to go to an Inservice meeting & that she'd love to have seen you, so please come back another time.  She said that she would.  Martha would be so glad to see her again.  This was a touching experience, one of many, at the Focus Center.
 
The next surprise was that the carpet man called to say that instead of Monday to put down the carpet in the hallway & the meeting room how about this Friday?  "Sure, that would be great" I answered back.  This is a wonderful 2nd. surprise Lord! 
 
The next surprise was Tucker was leaving & when I was at the door saying "good bye" to him there was Dan coming down the parking lot heading right to the door of the Focus Center.  I said "I don't let strangers in, you know".  "Hi Dan", I'm so happy to see you, it's been about a month right"?  "Ha ha, did you forget I told you that I was working on the campaign for the party".  "Oh, I must have forgotten", I said, "sorry Dan, it's soooo good seeing you again"!  Are you here to work because if you are I have work for you to do.  "Okay what is it"?  "I need you to put the diapers in the bags & label them the size that it is, okay".  "No problem Mary".  He was busy with the diapers & I was busy with the paper work when I looked up & there was my landlord.  "Hi Bernie, what brings you here tonight"?  "I was wondering if I could use these tables for the weekend"?  I said I would let you borrow them but they're not mine but you could use the tables that the literature is on".  "No, that's okay I'll rent some tables or just go ahead & buy some".  It's no problem, are you sure"?  "I'm sure", he said back.  I said that I was just thinking of calling him to give him next months rent early.  He said that he would appreciate it if I did.  So I wrote out a check for our first months rent of $1,800, this is now including our new Great Room that we got recently & got it ready for the '40 Days for Life" Rally this Tuesday from 5:30pm to 8:30pm.  He likes the room, it looks great, he said.  Thanks again Lord for this happened so quickly that I my head is still spinning.  After he left & then Dan left I stayed to do some more work until about 9pm & it was time for me to go home & to eat supper.  Busy & fruitful day :)
 
 

Thursday, September 16, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I knew that today was going to be horrible & I was right!  Martha was taking her friend to the eye doctor for surgery, so it was just Bill, who will be 81 years old next week.  He was across the street & I was where I always stand buy the big bad bushes.  I think that someone gave them Miracle Grow.  I took just one sign & the literature box, for it was raining hard, ick!  Oh, I don't like the rain, to get all wet is icky.  I always bring a change of clothes with me now, smart right.  It's because I learned the hard way, I've been soaked, several times, & I had no clothes to change into, talk about real icky :(   So it was the Lord & I defending life today, just Him & me.  When I arrived, at the center, there was Rose & a client already waiting for me to open up the Material Aid Room.  Before I left to go outside I asked Rose if she could make me a sandwich & I gave her a couple of assignments, in the center. 

Off I go into battle & battle it was today, what else do I expect at an abortion mill.  I was now out on the sidewalk trying to call out to the girls, without the mega phone, because when it gets wet it doesn't work until it dries.  So I was using my wimpy female voice, the best I could.  Cars were coming in & out of Planned Parenthood & I called out to them offering them help at the Focus Center 2 doors down.  A young man was walking down the sidewalk with a Rosary around his neck.  I said to him "don't forget to pray the Rosary that you're wearing".  "This is my Lord's Cross", he said & then went into Planned Parenthood.  I was shocked but then I remembered him.  He gave me a hard time this past summer when I spoke to him he was quite belligerent, telling me that his mother works here at Planned Parenthood.  Now he seems to have a peace about him with no belligerence.  Maybe his mother will see a change in her son & get out of Planned Parenthood, for both of their sakes.  Hope so! 

Rose was good to bring me out the chicken sandwich & ice tea.  It seemed to be raining less & hopefully soon it will stop all together.  Yeah!  I thanked her & then I asked her if she could go inside, the center & bring me some more signs & the mega phone.  She said that she would.  She's terrific & such a blessing to the work of the Focus Center.  She works hours in the Material Aid Room  to sort out baby & children clothes & to help our moms select clothes, when they come in.  She also makes up our Truth packets & cleans the toys when they come in.  She is so good with people we love & appreciate her, so much. 

I was waiting to wolf down my sandwich so as not to miss anyone coming into this death mill.  It was time to take a bit of my sandwich , for I was growing faint but I knew when I did started eat my sandwich there would be someone to help.  Right again!!  I looked up & saw two young people, a boy & a girl, on the sidewalk.  I started to speak to them with my mouth empty.  I showed them the pictures of the aborted children, that seemed to effect the young girl especially.  I asked then if they would like to come into the pregnancy center which was 2 doors down.  I was sure glad that Suzanne was now in the center.  The young girl said in a coy way, "we were just waking down the sidewalk" but then the guy was heading into the parking lot of the abortion mill.  I said to him to get out of the driveway, where do you think that you're going?  I new that she was pregnant because I showed her a rubberized baby at 12 weeks & she said quickly "is that what my baby looks like".  Oh yea, he or she does.  Through the grace of God it took me about 10 minutes to convince them to follow me into the Focus Center where Suzanne awaited to counsel them or anyone else I brought in to her.  I was so happy when they entered the 'hall of hope' at the center.  

After a little while a woman was walking into the vets, across the street with her dog, hollered over to me saying "pro choice, pro choice, pro choice".  I hollered back to her "you mean pro death, don't you.  Oh little doggie your mom is going into the vets to have you aborted, sorry little doggie, I tried to stop her but she wouldn't listen, sorry".  She walked in & came out about an hour later & didn't say a word.  As she drove by I said for her to repent.  Off she went down the street, hopefully contemplating that life is precious.  She may think of her dog, as being so special, but we know that people are more important, for we are created in the image & likeness of God.  Animals, are not, but they are a gift from God, to give us love.  For I know, I have a cat named Godfree.   
 

Now my trouble had just started.  A car drove into Planned Parenthood & as always I call out to the people in the car to tell them that we can help them & what Planned Parenthood is all about.  Two young girls came out of the car & said something to me but they were to far away tfor me to hear what the one girl was saying.  They both went into Planned Parenthood & were there for awhile.  When they came back out the one girl, who was the passenger, said something to me & again I was to far away to hear what she was saying.  I was now by myself for Bill had to go. The car was coming out of the parking lot & it stopped & the young girl, who was the passenger said to me, "why are you hear?  I'm a Christian so shut your blank, blank, mouth".  I said "no, you're not Christian maybe a pretend one but not a real one for a real Christian wouldn't speak that way".  Just then my cell phone rang & I said to her "just a minute I have to get this".  Believe it or not they waited until I got off the phone & then she continued to say "why don't you leave these girls alone you blank, blank".  I then said to her "your tongue is going to fall out, you need your mouth cleaned up".  Off they went into the sunset, only kidding but they finally did leave & went up the street towards E. Main St..  'The End', so I thought but I was wrong.  About a half hour later a car was coming very close to where I was standing on the sidewalk & I said "be careful, you're to close". Then I got all wet.  My sweet girl went to Wendy's to get a lemonade & didn't finish it so she thought that she would throw the rest of it out on my face, how nice of her.  The liquid hit my face & right eye, it felt sticky, it must have been lemonade, my favorite but only on a hot day.  I was by myself so I couldn't leave all the signs & literature box alone for someone to take or destroy it, so I couldn't leave.  It was about 10 minutes later just enough time for the two girls to go to the store to buy a bottle of water.  It again happened so fast, but this time she stuck her head out the car window to throw water at me from the bottle.  I was taking a call on my cell phone when the second hit came.  I called out to her saying "will you stop".  Maybe they thought that I was on the phone calling the police.  I wish I had more information but I didn't so I decided not to call the police.  These girls were probably 'post abortive', to say the least.  I wish that I could have helped them...... I called the center to ask if Suzanne could ring me put a bottle of water, not to throw at anyone, but to cleanse my right eye out.  She did & I then splashed it on my right eye, to rinse it out.  You should have seen the guy in the parking lot of the business right next door, the look on his face was priceless.  I wonder what he thought I was doing with the water.  He'll never know.  Thanks Suzanne for saving the day!!

I looked down the street & I saw an elderly man walking up the street with a large can in his hands, it looked like a paint can hut as he drew closer to me I saw that it up an open can that was empty.  I looked the other way briefly & when I turned back I saw that he was seated on the wooden ledge that surrounds Planned Parenthood's bushes. He mumbled a comment, about the graphic picture of the aborted baby, who was massacred by abortion, that was straight from Hell & for the first time ever, out on the front lines, I said for him to "shut up".  I had the crucifix & earlier I had said the Hail Mary prayer & the St. Michael the Archangel prayer, against the Evil One, now I was praying in tongues.  All of a sudden he is using a demonic voice & in a different language.  It was straight from the Exorcist movie.  I said "you have two seconds to leave before I call the police".  He immediately stood up & walked up the street to where ever.  This was another spittle attack against life, three times in less then 2 hours.  Thank you Lord Jesus for protecting me against the attacks from the Evil One.

Since I had Suzanne on the sidewalk & a few minutes later Elaine came to bring the chairs to the center I asked them both since it was around 4pm to help me carry the signs & literature box into the center, which they did. So God sent me 2 people to help me.  I was now in the center & Rose was helping another mother out in the Material Aid Room.  We served 6 moms on Tuesday & Wednesday & today, Thursday many more.  I was settling in when the doorbell rang.  I went to the door to see three young girls at the door.  I opened the door & asked if I cold help them.  The one girl said "I'd like a pregnancy test, then the other girl said "I want a pregnancy test" & the other girl said "I need one too".  I invited them into the center & asked "how are you all related"?  The one girl said "we're all sisters". Something is wrong with this family dynamics.  I was glad that they came to the Focus Center where they will be safe & so will their children be too, if they are pregnant.  I brought them into the Rose Room & because there were three girls I asked them to fill out their own Intake Sheet.  I spoke with the girls & hem started to do the pregnancy tests.  The one sister was pregnant.  She was 15 years old & said that she's been dating her boyfriend for 5 years.  What!!  She's been dating him since she was 10 years old. Where was her parents??  She was open for life & so where her 2 sisters for they were excited in being Aunts & had already named the baby after them.  I spoke to the other two girls about abstinence.  The one girl said that she was going to now save herself for her husband.  The other sister hopefully will follow suit.  I said to them not to try to get pregnant because your sister is expecting just enjoy being Aunts.  They agreed. The one girl was hungry so I went & got each of them a snack & a bottle of water. They all took a Truth packet & I gave them the Growth & Development DVD & the 12 week of rubberized baby to take with them to witness to others.  I asked them to keep away from Planned Parenthood & they said that they were just over there today, probably just after I left to come into the center, & they told them that unless they were willing to terminate they wouldn't do a pregnancy test so they saw our sign on the sidewalk & came to Focus for assistance.  Which I'm glad that they did, thank God.  I asked what their parents would say about this news & the pregnant girl said that she will be all right with it & so will her boyfriend.  I said to her don't let anyone talk you into an abortion & she said that she wouldn't let anyone talk her into it.  This was good news.  I said for them to call me if they needed any assistance, for I'm only a phone call away.  I showed them the Material Aid Room & said for her to come back to get some nice things for her baby when she finds out if her baby is a girl or boy.  She said "thank you & I will".  I gave them Compass Care's phone number for an ultrasound & for STD testing which the other girls were inquiring about.  I hope that today their lives will change for the better & to make good choices for themselves, from now on.  A 'new life' was left alone to grow & be born, next year.  Yeah!! These girls were young & I hope & pray like all our girls that their parents will do better in showing good example & to teach their children better & how to respect their bodies & to be chaste & to enjoy their lives as teenagers & young people until they're married.
  
Great News at Focus!!!   Another precious baby has been born!  Little, or should  say our big baby Matthew weighed in at 8Lb. 11 oz. on September 14th., mother & child are doing well.  Mom has decided to breast feed.  For more information: http://www.breastfeeding.com/ & http://www.llli.org/nb.html.  Best way to feed your baby, if possible :)

 

Monday September 20, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I arrives at the center at 9am to help paint the all purpose room a darker green.  It's alight green now & doesn't go with the new earthy toned rug that was just put in.  Frank was suppose to paint so I waited until 9:20 & then called Martha. Just then the doorbell rang & it was Frank & Jerry, I was so happy to see painter instead of one.  Well that changed real fast.  Frank took a look at the room & said that he couldn't paint today but tomorrow & Jerry wasn't to excited about painting alone.  Frank said that he would go home & get the paint brushes & the drop clothes & the ladder so Jerry & I waited.  He really didn't want to do it so I argued with him until he said "yes".  Frank came back with all the paint stuff & left then Jerry & I argued a bit more & he told me to just go, so I did, I went into the new Great Room & took a 2 hour nap, among all the noise that woke me up about 10 times but I finally woke up refreshed to say the least.  I went into the other room & exclaimed what a great job Jerry did!  Even though it needed a second coat in some spots & he touched up the other wall even though it wasn't the same shade of green, but whose complaining.  I'll deal with all of that another day & time.  At least the room will be ready for the '40 Days for Life' Kick Off Rally tomorrow night, thank God.  Jerry left to go to church & I made a couple of phone calls first, before the noon Mass, one was to the carpet man Jason who knocked off $50 for our accountant's room, up the hall, because he got out all his furniture instead of the carpet men having to do it.  Yeah!  Then I called the landlord to ask him to come pick up the remnant rugs in the all purpose room & that I had his favorite drink for him as a thank you.  Enjoy your sweet Walter wine Bernie & thank you for the new rugs in the hallway & in the all purpose room.  Looking good.  He brought this guy with him that gave me the creeps.  He said some strange things & when we accidentally bumped into each other he made a comment like "oh we bumped into each other, oh wow".  Icky man...  He also said "are you planning to bring your bed in the new room"?  Duh, no I don't think so creepy guy.  Sexual comments make my skin crawl but I hold my own, not as a former victim, but as a survivor. 
 

After Mass I went to the second hand store to see if they had any pictures for our new wall.  They had nothing, boo hoo.  As I was going back to the center & decided that I must eat so the plan was to go to Wendy's then go to the center to lots more work.  Well plans change quickly for as I was driving, not good, I got a call & it was a client saying that she was at the center right now.  I told her to wait & that I'd be there in 5 minutes.  When I arrived at the center I saw two girls waiting for me.  I let them in, one of the girls is our client, she brought in her friend for a pregnancy test.  As I was doing the test, she who is due in January, was freely shopping in our Material Aid Room, having a ball.  The pregnancy test & teaching was completed, then our newest client went into the Material Aid Room, to do some shopping for her 2 year daughter.  They both left very happy.  I asked our client to get me some brochures from Healthy Moms program, next to St. Mary's & she said that she would & she will bring them to me at the end of the week.  Thanks dear one.  Life is changing for her, praise God!!  Then after the two girls left the doorbell rang again & again & again.  I did 3 pregnancy tests & 10 people came & received clothing from the Material Aid Room, today.  First of all the center is closed on Mondays until 4pm & I didn't put out the sign, on the sidewalk, & we had all these wonderful people come & receive help & love & education here at Focus today.  God is Great!!  I finally ran out to get a hamburger at Wendy's for I was about to faint.  When I came back I prayed for help to get these 2 rooms ready for tomorrow.

My prayer was answered I received much help in getting everything done for tomorrow. Bill & Francis helped me out with the big things.  Thanks guys!  Pat, our Monday evening counselor, Martha, who came later to help out, & myself had a Fund Raiser Meeting for about an hour & a half.  Very productive it was.  These ideas will help us to raise money for Focus so we can pay the rent & our other expenses.  Things are happening & God is blessing our ministry.  Both room plus the bathrooms look good for the Kick Off Rally...can't wait!!! 

Tuesday, September 21, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
& the '40 Days for Life' Kick Off Rally at the Focus Center
 
When Martha & I arrived at the center we were kept quite busy & didn't have a chance to get out on the front line until about 1:30pm, which broke my heart.  Being on the front lines is a matter of life & death, for the little ones.  It was frustrating, but we had several moms come in to receive baby & children clothes & diapers, which was important.  Sandy was there to help them for Rose didn't show up today, hope she is okay.  Donna called in sick, so she wasn't going to be there today on the front lines, & Mary S. is celebrating her 25th. Wedding Anniversary & is in California for 2 weeks.  So it was just Martha & I out on the front lines.  Jerry showed up much later, to pray.  Rick the '40 Days for Life' Coordinator came & around 1:10pm to start to set up for the rally at 5:30pm.  I was doing so many things that my head began to spin.  Well, Martha & I finally went out on the front lines.  I saw that the abortionist Rachael Phelps wasn't there but there could have been another abortionist there to take her place.  You just have to treat everyone like they were here for an abortion so as not to miss anyone, until you're told differently by the person.  Well that happened.  A car came out & stopped along side of us.  I popped my head near the car & began to witness what Planned Parenthood does in there.  They listened to both Martha & I.  I gave them a Truth packet & a DVD on Black Genocide,  The young girl & guy were all so nice & asked for a doctors name.  I went over to the literature box & got out our small list of pro life doctors to give to her.  She looked at it & said that 2 of the doctors would work.  Yeah!  They said "thank you" & then went into the vets parking lot to turn around.  We waved at them as they passed by us & they waved back to Martha & I.   They were open to the Truth, thank God, so now they have a 'New Beginning', through the grace of God.  It's the people that are closed minded that scare me.
 
I heard some noise down the street & saw that two guys were riding skate boards & hollering at Martha & I.  I hollered back to them saying "do you want me to call the police"?  We've had trouble with guys on skate boards before.  They have spit on our signs & crashed into them & were nasty as they rode by us, so I was ready with my cell phone for anything.  They disappeared as they were crossing Gibbs St. pass our strip mall were we have our pregnancy center.  Bye boys just grow up & keep your nasty mouths closed.  No respect for 'life' which they enjoy.  Well I was wrong.  It was about 20 minutes later that one of the boys came passed Martha & I on his skate board mouthing off, right in front of us.   I wasn't going to mess around so I pretended to call the police right in front of him.  He quickly went down Wayland St. & disappeared, hopefully never for us to see him again, until he repents.  I love this scare method for it usually works.  Only 2 times in all my years it didn't work the abusers just stayed there until I could think up another way to get rid of them harassing us.  That's not bad, two out of a hundred. 
 
Now it was the girls turn.  It was a nasty female on a motorcycle stretching her wheels going into Planned Parenthood.  All I said to her when she puled into the parking lot & shut her noisy motor off was "your guilty, please come to the realization & get help, forgiveness & healing".  Into Planned Parenthood she goes.  She's there about less than 5 minutes & come out talking to the death escort Barry Swan.  I spoke to her again & she gunned her motor to drown me out, I mean the Truth.  As she passed by me I told her to "repent".  She didn't care to hear anything she was to busy making noise.   I hope that she makes it. 
 
A little while later Martha & I noticed that there was a tomato in the street near us.  Perhaps someone had thrown a tomato at us from the other side of the street when we were not looking & missed, for it wasn't there earlier.  Poor shot, thank God, now that would have been messy to clean up.  It was a hot day & both Martha & I were dressed for winter, so we were baking to say the least.  She later went home to take a shower & to put on lighter clothes because it was so very hot.  Mind you I'm not complaining for I'd rather be hot that cold.  Burr...    I did take off my sweater but I had a turtle neck underneath.  Maybe I should check the weather report before I go outside, next time. 
 
I was counseling the people in the cars that ride into Planned Parenthood with love & knowledge & I was by the fence calling out when all of a sudden I heard a loud voice from across the street say "Mary..., I know that you're a boy with a wig on".  Oh no my nemesis Jim.  My voice to him must appear deep though it's really not it's mostly high pitched.  I have long blonde hair am tall with green eyes & certainly look & act as a female.  Poor Jim, maybe he's thinking of some one else.  Then he said "Mary I'm going to call Fr. O'Malley to have him do an exorcist".  I called back to him saying "please get some new material, while trying to insult me, this is old stuff".  Just before this happened, my sweet friend Donna arrived, with her darling daughter Hannah who is 14 months old.  She didn't like what she heard him say to me so she decided to walk across the street & speak to him.  When she came back about 10 minutes later, all she said was, "Mary we'll have to pray for him".  I guess he was in the war & is confused to what we're all about in front of Planned Parenthood.  He said that he was a Christian. All I can say is that some one has failed him in his Church.  After Donna left I went across the street to see Jerry, who was on his knees praying, holding a crucifix, praying to end abortion.  Then I heard Jim say "Mary now what are you doing"?  I just stayed there & prayed.  I did say "God will take care of you".  He quivered at that statement.  All I mean is that God doesn't want you to persecute your brother or sister in the Lord & He loves those who He disciplines.  It wasn't a curse or anything like that.  We are all responsible with what we say & do & not do, including myself.  I have to forgive him, for that's what it is in being a Christian. 
 
A skuffy older man came walking up the street & he stopped to tell me that when he was 21 years old, his 17 year old girlfriend got pregnant, & she wanted an abortion.  He talked her out of it & his daughter is 37 years old now.  Thank God for him talking action in saving his daughter's life. This is great news!!   
 
I was standing on the sidewalk when I saw that a young woman had just come out of Planned Parenthood.  I hollered over to her offering her the Truth packet.  She walked over to me, with no expression on her face & I smiled at her & gave her the packet without saying a word, I asked her no questions, which was very unusual for me.  Nothing came out of my mouth. I later regretted that I had asked her no questions but I have to believe that the Holy Spirit was in charge & not me.  After she took the packet she walked back over to the other side of the sidewalk, then walked up the street probably to catch a bus.  I was just so happy that she took the packet.  Well, she has been in my life ever since.  More to come on tomorrow's Front Line Weekly.  I left the sidewalk to get ready for the Board Meeting & the Kick Off Rally, for the '40 Days for Life' in our new Great Room at Focus!! 

 At the Board Meeting we voted our newest member to the Board tonight.  Rob is our longest acting male sidewalk counselor, in front of Planned Parenthood. Rob & I have been there for almost 15 years now.

  
The people were coming in to the Focus Center for the Kick Off Rally for the '40 Days for Life' which will be in front of Planned Parenthood at 114 University Ave. in Rochester, NY.  For 40 days there will be people in front of the abortion facility praying to end abortion there & all over the world.  We had the walls painted & the new carpet put down & the room looks great.  What a blessing it has been for our center which is expanding.  Rick, the Rochester Coordinator, came in early to set up the tables  & chairs & the sound system for the 3 testimonies which were to follow the buffet meal & a blessing by Fr. Brian Carpenter, from Peace of Christ Church.  Pat, our grandmother & great grandmother of the 2 almost aborted babies, was first to give her testimony & what a testimony she gave.  Pat had brought the 2 precious babies with her & Fr.
