Brian & I were holding them & the Catholic Courier photo journalist took the pictures.  Check out: http://www.peaceofchristparish.org/focus.php &
http://www.40daysforlife.com/ROCHESTER/index.cfm?load=page&page=7. 
The second testimony was from Doriena, who had been raped when she was a teenager, & her mother made her have an abortion.  She became post abortive & years later had 2 more abortions.  She deeply regrets having her 3 children killed by abortion & now is married with 5 living children.  I said hi to her for she remembers me from another time when I shared with her that I conceived twins from my rape back in 1971 & lost them by a normal miscarriage, which greatly affected me.  After the 2 powerful testimonies Rick showed a DVD of Abby Johnson's testimony, she was the Director of Planned Parenthood, who left when she was asked to assist at an abortion in her facility, at Bryan/College Station, Texas, 1 year ago.  Check out:  http://40daysforlife.com/blog/?p=1202 for more information in regards to her testimony.  We had a blessed time with friends & food & sharing.  What an evening at Focus!! 

 

Wednesday September 22, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
 
(As I look back on this day, for it is mostly a blank, for the only thing I was consecrating on was to save her life & her baby's life, through the grace of God.  She became such a challenge to me, over the next couple of weeks, which was a life changing experience for her & I). 
 
Martha, Carole & I were standing on the sidewalk, like we usually do, praying & counseling when a girl came walking up the street.  I recognized her pants for the day before.  They had the logo on it MCC on the leg of the pants.  When the girl came up closer I asked her if she was here yesterday & she said "yes".  Then Martha said to her "are you hear for an abortion"?  The reply from the woman was "yes".  "Oh no" we all said at once.  She said "I don't want it".  Martha talked to her mostly for I was still in shock, for she was the girl that I handed the truth packet to yesterday afternoon & didn't say anything to her or ask her any questions, before going into the center for the Board Meeting & the Rally. I wasn't in a hurry when she approached me yesterday I just saw that her face & thought that I was glad that she came over to me to accept the packet.  She then said that she had put the RU 486 inside her.  I asked if I could show her a picture of what her baby looks like at 7 weeks & to follow me into the pregnancy center, which she did.  I brought her into the Rose Room & talked to her asking if I could call the doctor & to take her to the doctor for him to remove the pills.  She said "no, I don't want it".  I thought to myself, please stop saying that.  I showed her the Growth & Development DVD & the rubberized 12 week old baby & other pictures too.  I gave her the doctors list & asked for her to call one of them to have the abortion pills taken out.  I then read to her the powerful poem 'My Life Depends on You'. Check Out:
http://il.youtube.com/watch?v=xHEnVupp17k&feature=related.  She started to cry.  I was hopeful then.  I spoke to her about the adoption program & she said that if she was going to have the baby then she would raise the baby but you still don't understand, she said to me, 'I don't want it".  My heart had dropped to my ankles.  As she left I asked her again to call the doctor & she said "maybe I will, I don't know yet".  I was a little hopeful for the first time.  As she was walking down the street I just hollered to her "we love you", "we love you", "we love you".   I cried & then walked slowly back to the front lines to be with Martha & Carole.  We discussed this situation.  I went to the computer, in the Focus Center's office, to email everyone so that they would pray for her & her precious, innocent baby.  They did.  The rest of the day was very difficult for I had no way to reach her.  I didn't ask for her to fill out an Intake Sheet because & I didn't want her to get up & leave.  She, if she needed me to reach me anytime, that she knew.  So it was up to her to contact me or not.  Talk about suffering, for the Lord.  If the Lord needed this kind of suffering then so be it to save the lives of both mother & child. 
 
The rest of this day was very difficult.  We did help other mothers who were open to life, by counseling them in the center, & we gave away many baby & children clothes in the Material Aid Room too.  Two moms came in with some of their children & the one mom was due soon with a baby girl.  Between the 2 moms they had 12 children between them.  Needless to say that they took a lot of things emptying 3 baskets of clothes.  Martha helped them in the room & told the kids to pick up the toys, that they had put on the floor before leaving, which they did.  They took at least 3 full bags of clothes, which is fine, for their families.  We are here to help.
 
The three Elim Institute Students came today & so did their director Helen came to meet me & to talk to me.  I kept the girls busy by dividing the diapers packages, by putting  half of them into a plastic bag, for our moms.  This way we could stretch our diaper supply so we can always have enough for all our moms who come in for them.  We are working on a Grant & also for Wegmans, to help the center out, with diapers, baby wipes & formula.  So much to do & hardly no time to do it all.  We ran out of plastic bags & Helen went out to purchase more for us.  Sandy, who helps us out on Tuesdays in the center, had just come in for a visit & she went with her to the Dollar General on Main St., she was glad of that for she doesn't live in Rochester but she said that she had a good sense of direction.  Better you than me, that's for sure.  They came back about 20 minutes later with 8 cartons of plastic bags.  Thanks so very much Helen.  The girls kept on going, going & going some more.  No one came in to the Material Aid Room for clothes until after they left.  Maybe next week girls, for the experience.  They are so kind & helpful & we are blessed to have them with us.
 
After the girls left at 6:30 pm Martha & I ate, hardly to say the least, for this pregnant girl, who had the RU 486 pills in her, that I had asked her name & she told me but I was to stressed out to remember it. (I asked her again when I saw her what her name was & I'll call her Ms. C. for privacy sake).  She was on my mind, that's for sure.  Pray, pray & pray some more I told everyone.  As a sacrifice for the Lord, I gave up my shot of Brandy, before bedtime for her & her baby, who is in danger of being killed by these deadly pills. Please check out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcgeR3hSM5Q
  
 
Thursday September 23,2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
 
We were on the sidewalk witnessing when all of a sudden I saw the young woman, that had taken the RU 486 pills, was walking down the street.  I recognized her immediately & she approached us.  All this happened so fast my head was spinning.  She said to me that Planned Parenthood won't give her anesthesia for the abortion so she wanted the pills to be taken out.  Oh my God it's happening!!  I quickly brought her to the center where Suzanne, our Thursday counselor was, & asked her to call the doctor to tell him that we were on our way.  Our regular doctor was out of town though so we called our other referral doctor.  He said to bring her right over.  I asked Martha to come with me for my legs were like jelly.  She told the other people, that were on the sidewalk praying, that she was leaving & for them to take over & off we went to the doctors office who is off of Genesee St..  The traffic was horrible, poor Martha was stopping at every light it seemed & there was road work ahead of us.  At one point the young lady said that she wanted to go home until Martha told her that women can die from these pills.  She said "how".  I quickly told her that they bleed to death.  She changed her mind about going home & we were at the doctors office about 10 minutes later.  We all got out of the car & went into the office where they took her to the back room to wait for the doctor, who was there ready to 'save a life'.  Martha & I waited in the waiting room until I couldn't stand the stress any longer & decided to go for a walk down Warwick Ave. which is right next to the doctors office.  I wanted to see the house where I lived when I was 6 years old when I was in second grade at St. Augustine's Catholic Church, which is now closed.  I made my First Holy Communion at that church.  I walked gingerly down the street looking at every house to find the one that I lived in.  I saw an elderly Black woman sweeping her driveway & decided to stop to talk to her.  This encounter was such a joy to my heart.  A wise & wonderful woman she was.  I told her that I once lived on this street about 54 years ago.  She said that she didn't live there then even though she has been there for many years.  She said that she lost her husband about 7 years ago & once worked at Strong in the Labor Room helping to deliver babies.  I asked if she assisted with abortions & she said "no baby, I wouldn't have done that".  Don't you love her.  Her next door neighbor came out & joined us.  I spoke with her for a few minutes & asked her to take care of Gwen, that was her name, & she said that she does.  I smiled & was happy to hear this.  I said "good bye & God bless" & continued to walk down the street to find the house.  I did.  I just stood there looking up at the window that was once my bedroom.  It was a duplex & we lived upstairs.  I just keep on looking & the people who were sitting on their porch next door started to look at me.  I said to them that I used to live in this house when I was 6 years old & I asked them some questions & they answered me.  I was afraid to leave Martha in the doctors office by herself for very long so I looked at the neighbors & said "what happened in this house shouldn't have happened to any child", for I was molested, by my father, in that house.  I walked back to the doctors to be with Martha.
 
We waited for the procedure of the pills to be taken out for about 45 minutes & we were talking to the patients that were waiting for the doctor not knowing what was going on, for he took our girl right away.  He came out of the examining room & I spoke with him & he said to pray for her & her baby.  I said that was a given & thanked him for taking her right away.  He said "no problem" & he walked back into the examining room.  She came out about 10 minutes later.  I asked her how she was doing & she said that she felt better once the pills were removed.  I was glad to hear his.  I thanked the office people for their cooperation in this urgent matter & said good bye & we all left.  When we got into the car our young lady said "I need a cigarette".  You got to be kidding, I thought, not another way to wreck this baby.  She was so stressed out that Martha & I thought, that this once, it might be better to let her have one, so I bought a pack of cigarette's & gave her just 1.  I went into a corner store on W. Main St. & asked for a pack of Newports & this young person appeared.  I asked him how old he was & he said 15.  I said that I didn't think that 15 year olds were to suppose to sell cigarette's.  He said that it was okay & if it wasn't he'd still do it.  That's another problem for another day.  (Days later I spoke to my police friend & he said that it was illegal & it can reported it to the Dept.of Tobacco Firearms and Alcohol)   She smoked it in the car with the window down.  As we were driving down Hudson Ave. the street where they shoot people all the time she asked for Martha to stop to get chicken wings.  Are you kidding I thought to myself.  Martha said "yes just tell me where to stop".  Well she was a help!!  The fun never stops!  We stopped at a Chinese Take Out that had chicken wings of course.  Her & I got out of the car while Martha was waiting in the car.  She put in an order & so did I for at this time Martha & I were hungry too.  While she was waiting for her order to come up a little girl around 7 years old waved at her.  She made a comment saying "see the little girl she just waved at me & I don't even know her".  The Lord was showing her the love of a child, to soften her heart for her child growing inside of her.  We then took her home with the understanding for her to call us if she needed anything & to call the doctor, in a couple of days, to schedule an ultrasound & exam.  She said that she would do it.  Martha & I drove back to the center to eat our Chinese chicken wings & they were good.  What a day as we praised God for all that He did through us, to save the life of His children, both hers & her baby's.  We told everyone, who were still praying, in front of Planned Parenthood, to pray some more for this situation & I sent out a prayer request to my email list also.  
 
 
 
Friday, September 24, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
 
I received a call from our new client Ms. C. & she wants to get out of her abusive house with her parents.  I then called a person that I met about 4 weeks ago after the noon Mass at Our Lady of Victory Church.  She asked what I do & I said that I am the director of a pregnancy center.  She said that she has taken in pregnant girls in her home.  I was so happy to hear this & I took down her name & phone number, so when our new mom called saying that she needed to find a place to live temporally I though of her.  I called her & she said for me to come to look at the room this evening at 7pm.  I called Ms. C & set up a time to pick her up to take her to see the room.  I picked her & her girlfriend & Ms.C around 6:30pm & drove them over to see the house off of St. Paul Blvd..  When we arrived we were greeted by Beverly & she showed us the room upstairs.  The room was very small but durable to the situation.  Then she said that she had a male tenant down the short hall.  She assured us that there would be no privacy issue but I felt uncomfortable with this surprise.  I remembered that she said that there was another room downstairs so I asked to see this room.  The room was off of the kitchen & had a powder room next to it.  It was by the back door which a porch, which was nice.  Beverly had no real rules to live in her home.  No curfew & your own key, just clean up after yourself which was a given.  This seemed like a wonderful place for our Ms. C to move into to get away from the chaos where she is now for her sake & that of her baby.  I & she & her friend were very happy.  Ms. C told Beverly that she will take it & asked when she could move in.  Beverly said how about Sunday at 2pm, we all agreed.  We thanked Beverly & left.  The girls were hungry so I stopped at Price Rite in a very bad neighbor because that's were is was, at least they had a policeman there walking around.  Oh boy!!
 
 
Sunday, September 27, 2010
 
Ms. C. made arrangements to move into the house that we went to on Friday.  She was suppose to move in at 2pm but changed the time to 9pm.  I called Martha so that she could go with me.  We made arrangements to meet at the center around 8:30pm, Martha is not a night person so this was very nice of her.  When she drove into the parking lot I noticed that her front right head light was out.  We debated what to do but figured that if she drives carefully we will be all right, until she can get it fixed the next day.  We took her car because it's bigger & holds more because Ms. C will be bringing all what she owns with her to the new place from her old home, otherwise we would have taken my smaller car.  We then picked up Ms. C with all her heavy bags & suitcases & we were off to her new beginning in her life once she decided to 'chose life' & had the RU 486 abortion pills taken out of her.  Martha & I were happy for her.  Well things can change real fast in life so always be ready but always trust in God for He is in control & loves us & His ways are not are ways for He is Wisdom & Love & Truth.  We got to the house off of St. Paul Blvd. & Beverly wasn't there like she was suppose to be.  Her male tenant answered the door puzzled when we said that we were here to have Ms. C move in.  He said that he new nothing of that arrangement for all he knew was that another man was going to stay in the empty room upstairs were he had a room & the room downstairs was going to be Beverly's pregnant niece's room.  He called Beverly on the phone to make sure about the arrangements & he was right.  How could she not have called us to tell us that the plans have changed??  Ms. C was very upset to say the least & called one of the shelters & she couldn't get in because of a sanction that was against her plus they had no room available either.  Oh Lord what are we to do at 9pm on a Sunday.  She said to Martha who was driving to take her to the park & I said "no you're not going to the park to sleep".  She said "don't tell me what to do" & got out of the car & ran like a gazelle down the street.  I hollered for her to stop for I can't run do to health issues but I did see from afar that she turned left at the corner, so I went back into the car to tell Martha so that we could pick her up.   Martha was backing out of the driveway & almost hit the tree behind her, she tried several times to straightened out until she told me to put my head down, which I did then she got out of the driveway safely.  She drove down the street & I told her to make a left & then we spotted our girl & stopped the car & asked her to come back into the car so we can try to make arrangements for tonight.  After talking about what just had happened the decision was made that Ms. C would spend the night at Martha's apartment.  We were trying to settle down because we were all upset with what had happened at Beverly's house. 
 
Next stop was the center.  Martha had to bring me back to get my car.  She made a turn down Hudson Ave. with police behind her.  The siren & lights were shinning, just like the movies, but this was real.  Martha stopped instead of having a car chase on Hudson Ave. one of the worst parts of town even where the police get shot.  We were surrounded & the flashlights were now shinning in the car looking for whatever, which we don't do.  Martha rolled down the window, to a woman police officer which meant business, which I can't blame her in that neighborhood but if you look at Martha all you see is sweetness, until she told me to shut up because I was laughing in the back seat.  It was a nervous laugh because I just couldn't imagine what could happen next.  She later said that she was sorry & I apologized to her for stressing her out more & being irritating, which I sometimes can be :( 
I rolled down the car window & said to the male police officer with the flashlight if he knew Officer Mike P?  I said this because I felt like a criminal, at this point, & I wanted the officers to know that we know one of their own but not everyone knows everyone, so it didn't help.  Sorry Officer Mike.  The officer asked Martha to show her license & registration & insurance card which she did & then asked her if she new why she was being stopped.  Martha told her it was because of her front headlight which was out & that she just found out about tonight & couldn't do anything about it until tomorrow.  The officer went back to her car to check out Martha & then came back with a ticket & told her that if she gets her car fixed tomorrow that she could send the proof in to get the ticket taken away.  Sounded good to Martha who was about to scream, with all that had taken place in such a short period of time late at night, & the night wasn't over with yet.  After the police had left to fight crime on the streets of Rochester, which is very dangerous & our prayers are with them, you could hear a pin drop in the car.  I don't remember if we talked at all but I think that we did.  We got to the center safe & sound & I got out & thanked Martha for all that she did this evening & to tell Ms. C that everything will work out just be patient & we are hear for her at all times & I said good bye & left.  I went into the center to do some work then went home around 12 midnight.  Tomorrow was another day.
 

 Wednesday, Sept. 29, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I entered the center for the main door was ajar, which it shouldn't be because anyone can walk right in & maybe do harm.  In this case it was a young girl who in the hallway & I asked what I could do for her.  She said that she was looking for the Realtor up the hall to confront him because of her apartment situation.  He wasn't there so I asked if she had any children & she said that she had two but her ex husband & mother are taking care of them because she was in jail.  She said that she was in jail for a fight nothing more.  "Okay" I said.  Then I noticed that her blouse was about to fall from her shoulders & she didn't have a bra on so I brought her into the Material Aid Room to find something that would cover her up.  She found a pullover & a light jacket to go over it.  I was glad that now she wouldn't accidentally expose herself to the public by shear innocence.  She seemed to be a nice girl that just had some bad things happen to her & she needs to find someone that cares.  She also took some nice things for her 2 children.  I hope that she can work out the problem with the Realtor.  Just after she left Martha came in to get the signs & literature box to take with her to the front lines.  I joined her & then Carole came, a short time later.  So it was us three until Tucker, Robert & Linda came later.  Before the other three people came I was using the mega phone in the parking lot, at this time there wasn't anyone coming or going to their car I was just talking on the mega phone giving out information about the evils of Planned Parenthood.

Just then a woman, who was parked right next to where the abortionist always parks, got out of her car & started ranting & raving.  I just kept on giving her the facts about abortion & what Planned Parenthood does in there to innocent babies & their mothers, especially the African American culture.  Some might disagree but I really didn't want to hear what she was saying I wanted her to hear the facts & the Truth, to educate herself.  Lots of luck.  She got back into her car after about 3 long minutes of verbal sparing between the two of us.  She moved her car right to where we stand by the bushes.  "Oh No"  Or maybe I should say "bring it on".  She parked & got out of the car & said to me who was standing by the fence "do you know who I am"?  "No" I said & she began to rant & rave on & on & on.  At the end she never told me who she was.  Some of the ranting was about showing the graphic signs to children.  Here we go again just like yesterday when the girl with the tattoos & gross ear lobe stretching earrings said the same thing.  We are not out here to traumatize the children but to save the children from being murdered by Rachael Phelps & all others at Planned Parenthood through chemical & surgical abortions.  What these pictures does is to convict the adults who blame it on the children.  It's called transference.  Tucker when he came tried to talk to her, so did Carole & Linda, but the lady just kept on going like the, generalized bunny.  The neighbor Sue Bovay came out to look to see what was going on, poor lady.  I went across the street with a graphic sign to stand next to Robert who was holding the graphic sign Malachi so when she came out she had to look at these pictures to see the horror of abortion.  The 3 year old in the car can't process what is going on & is probably looking down or out the side window.  This is between us adults that can't face the Truth about abortion & what Planned Parenthood does in there.  Stop compromising & betraying your race.  I'm not trying to be mean but I try to make people realize what is really going on at Planned Parenthood. Maybe it's to hard for anyone to believe.  I know it's hard for me.

One woman hollered out her window "Planned Parenthood saved my life".  I said "Planned Parenthood kills children & God saved your life".  God turns evil & makes it for good.  He's not going to punish someone for the evils of Planned Parenthood.  She never told me the whole story she just drove away.  Enough said.  Maybe they caught in time an Etopic pregnancy or caught some type of breast or cervical cancer?  My question to Planned Parenthood is why can't you help woman by NOT killing their children or filling them up with birth control's steroids that does hurt them????  It's MONEY that what it is & an agenda of Population Control & Black Genocide.   Not reporting statuary rape, just gives them more power against the victim, so if she's pregnant they can do an abortion on her.  More $$$.  They are EVIL & that's that.  I rest my case. 

Two girls were walking up the street & Carole & I stopped them to talk to them.  They were effected by the pictures of aborted babies.  The girls who said that they were sisters didn't believe in abortion put the one sister said that she was going into Planned Parenthood for Birth Control.  Carole & I told then about what it really does to the baby that can be conceived & to their bodies too.  They took a Truth packet but walked right into Planned Parenthood.  They came out about less then 10 minutes later & I asked the one girl if she got the Birth Control.  She said "no".  Thank God & I know that He used her sister to help change her mind.  I only hope & pray that she stays strong & also her younger sister too.  One girl & life at a time.

 Two girls were walking up the street & Carole & I stopped them to talk to them.  They were effected by the pictures of aborted babies.  The girls who said that they were sisters didn't believe in abortion put the one sister said that she was going into Planned Parenthood for Birth Control.  Carole & I told then about what it really does to the baby that can be conceived & to their bodies too.  They took a Truth packet but walked right into Planned Parenthood.  They came out about less then 10 minutes later & I asked the one girl if she got the Birth Control.  She said "no".  Tank God & I know that He used her sister to help change her mind.  I only hope & pray that she stays strong & also her younger sister too.  One girl & life at a time.

The Material Aid Room was a buzzing with so many moms who were blessed in the room today.  Martha was doing a pregnancy test & while she was in the Rose Room overseeing the test, her hand that she fell on in the bathroom earlier this morning, started to stiffen up & become very painful.  After the client had left she went to the freezer to get an ice pack & a couple of Advils, for the pain.

When Tucker had come to peacefully protest he told us that his father had died last night at the hospital.  He was 91 & was the father of 10 children & a good husband & father to his children.  May he rear in peace.  I gave my condolence to Tucker & his family during this very difficult time, even though they had expected it for awhile,  Death is still unexpected, when it arrives never the less, it is a heartache, for those who are left behind.  We still need to grieve our loss no matter how old the person is.  Crying is okay & highly recommended in the grieving process.  

Martha &  I were about to eat, it was around 5:15pm, for she had to go to her family's house for a birthday party at 6pm, when the doorbell rang.  Rose said a girl & a guy were at the door & she was asking for a pregnancy test.  I looked at Martha & asked her if she would do it. I knew that she would the best choice for right now.  She took a bite of her sausage sandwich, for she was hungry, & off she went into the Rose Room to assist our new client. I was half dead but I didn't let on, so I felt she was better than I would be, at this time, even though she probably didn't think so.  I felt badly for her hand was hurting her.  We do take turns, as much as possible, giving the pregnancy tests, but not always.  When she came out of the Rose Room, after the client & her boyfriend had left, she came right into the kitchenette to finish off her sausage sandwich & homemade home fries, that I had made & brought in for our supper. She wasn't mad at me, Martha has a good heart.  I have to make decisions & I try to make the right ones, through the power of the Holy Spirit, everyday here at the Focus Center.  I pray for guidence to do the right thing at all times & whe I fail I ask for forgiveness & help to do better. "Pride before the storm'.  When Martha left to go to her party, I worked half dead, until about 9pm.  At this time, most of us pro lifers are suffering with something or another.  Most of us are in some kind of pain or discomfort.  This is good.  It means that the Devil is threatened by what God is doing through us, & we are under attack from the Enemy, who has no power over us, for we are covered in the Precious Blood of Jesus & in the Mantel of the Blessed Mother, for protection.  Earlier this afternoon Linda, who was out on the front lines, was reading the Exorcism Prayer, against the Evil One.  We also pray the Rosary & say the Divine Mercy prayer, out on the front lines, to come against the power of the Enemy, who lies & tries to destroy us pro lifers & all people. 

Wounded soldiers for Christ,who will restore our souls & bodies,to keep on fighting the good fight, in saving lives for Him.   

Thursday, September 30, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

A car drove in with a young girl & guy.  I called to them & pleaded with them not to have their baby killed.  They didn't listen & went right in.  The guy came out & sat in the car the whole time.  She came out about two hours later & when they drove out she gave me the 'bird'.  How very sad for her & for him.  Their hell has now begun.  Why didn't they listen to the Truth spoken, the words of help for them.  Now they are to suffer for taking an innocent life that was just created by God. 

I looked down the street & I saw Carole walking towards me.  Yeah!!  God heard my plea.  For she'll be with me on the front lines today.  She brought Cleveland, our street person, who we have adopted, a new jacket & she had bought him new shoes, socks, pants & a shirt yesterday.  He put on his new jacket & he was so happy.  Carole's going to get him long underwear next.  He's a new man.  She also gave him some $$ & when he came back, later on, he smelled like beer.  I guess he wanted to celebrate his new clothes.  A leopard doesn't usually change his spots.  We love & accept Cleveland just where he is.  Martha was in the center calling our clients that 'chose life' to see how they were doing & if they needed anything. She had her hand in a bandage & she couldn't get it wet so she stayed in the center today. She made me a sandwich, for I was faint like, & she brought it outside where I was. She wrapped her hand in a plastic bag.  Thanks Martha for the nourishment.  Rose came later & helped out, in the center.  She works so hard 3 days a week & we are blessed in having her.  She likes chocolate so I will get her some as a 'thank you' for all the things that she does, at the Focus Center.  We couldn't do without her.

Robert, a new '40 Days for Life' recruit, came to be a witness on the front lines this afternoon.  He holds a graphic sign Malachi, right across the street, so when people leave Planned Parenthood they will see him.  Someone that's not afraid to show the Truth about what is going on at Planned Parenthood.  It is refreshing, to say the least.  Welcome Robert.  He looks like Indiana Jones. 

It was 4pm & Carole had to leave & Martha wanted me in the center so we could eat & get ready to go see our little Birthday boy, Khy-Meir, who is 1 years old today.  He was almost aborted last year by the RU486 abortion pill.  Pat, the grand mother, had pulled into the parking lot of Planned Parenthood & came out of her car & walked over to me, on the sidewalk, holding a graphic sign.  She walked over to me saying "I don't want my granddaughter to do that".  I replied "I don't want her either, come follow me".  I lead her into the Focus Center to be counseled by Suzanne & Maria.  Maria took her to our doctor & he took out the abortion pills & saved the life of little Khy-Meir, who just had about an half an hour to live.  Praise God!!  We have been blessed to be apart of this family ever since. 

Just before we left, the doorbell rang, & it was one of our mothers that 'chose life' out on the front lines.  She was walking into Planned Parenthood, with her friend, who is now our client, & she changed her mind after receiving a Truth packet & seeing the graphic sign Malachi.  Her baby is due October 10th..  Yeah!  Her & her mother came into the center to receive some nice things that we just received from the 'Baby Shower' at the Church of the Assumption.  What great gifts from these fine people, all brand new.  After they left the doorbell rang again.  It was a girl & a guy wanting a pregnancy test.  Martha & I were just about to sit down to have our supper.  I asked Martha if she could do the pregnancy test.  She took a bite of her sausage sandwich & went into the Rose Room to assist these fine people.  She later said that the girl wanted to go into Planned Parenthood, to get the Morning After Pill, but they saw our sign & they came here instead to get the help that they deserved.  The boyfriend heard some bad things about Planned Parenthood & he didn't want her to go there.  Oh really!!  Hopefully the word is getting out.  My goal is to ruin the reputation of Planned Parenthood by telling the people the Truth about it. That should do it. 

 

 Sunday, October 3, 2010 at the Focus Center "Respect Life' Sunday & "Life Chain" Sunday

I got an early call from Christine, our pregnant girl, who 'chose life' a week ago by having Martha & I take her to the doctors to get the RU486 abortion pills out of her & she needed a ride to the shelter, from her mothers house.  She said that she will be waiting on the front steps.  I quickly got up & dressed but before I left I got a call from Martha saying that her car broke down on the rode yesterday & she has no car.  Plans quickly changed.  I had to much in my car to hold Martha, Christine & her bags so I needed first to go to the center to drop off the signs for the 'Life Chain' & the donuts & cider & other things, to make room for everybody, in the car.  I called Christine to tell her to hold on that I would get there to pick her up as quickly as I could.  I'm driving on the expressway then my cell phone goes off.  I had to get it out of my pocket & to my ear answering it with much excitement.  I always think that it is an emergency & I must learn to let it ring & it can go to voice mail & I will get the message when I'm stopped.  You can't kill someone to save someone!!  You can't use the cell phone while driving.  If it's for a pregnancy test then I will get the message & will call the girl back but I don't want to kill anyone on the rode when I'm going to do something good.  It was someone who wants to donate children's clothes to the center.  I told him my situation & quickly got off the phone.  I was now in the city to go straight to the center, so I thought.  Oh no!!  There were police blocks on every corner for a Breast Cancer 'Walk for Hope'.  I found the next entrance to the expressway & went 15 minutes out of my way to pick up Christine.  I finally got to her house & got her in the car & went to the center the back way.  We emptied the car & then went to pick up Martha at her apartment in Gates.  Christine got some more of her clothes that she left at Martha's a week ago, when she stayed there, after leaving her mothers' house.  We were all hungry & Ms. C needed some minutes for her phone, that we will provide for her, during this very difficult time, so we headed to the store for the minutes for her cell phone & new coat for it is cold outside.  We got to the store & we got the minutes but this large store didn't have the coats out on the rack now, in October!!  What are you waiting?  They start to have Christmas items out in the end of October.  Well thank God, for I had just bought a jacket & had worn it only twice & it was in the trunk of my car.  It fit Christine very well & looked good on her too.  Yeah!!  Now she has phone minutes, a new warm jacket & a new home, for her 'new life' today.  Let's go eat.  We went to a Greek restaurant & had a very good lunch.  It was time to get Christine to the shelter.  It was a private shelter so we couldn't go on the elevator with her.  Martha & I gave her a big hug & said "good bye & we are there for you at any time so please just call us".  She said "thank you & good bye".  We felt relieved that finally our girl was in a safe & warm place until she can get an apartment of her own, & get ready for her baby to be born next year.  We will see her through & have a Baby Shower for her next year too.  Today is a 'new beginning' for dear Christine.

Martha & I were on our way to the center to get ready for the 'Life Chain' which will start at 2pm to 3:30pm.  When we arrived to the center we got things ready & put out the coffee.  The people started to arrive & they signed in & received their sign & then walked up University Ave., to E. Main St. to witness to 'life'.  The cars that drive by have to see people standing, side by side in a line, with a life message, about abortion, on the sign that they are holding to witness to the public.  I was standing in front of the center to be there if some one comes late to join the line.  I was holding a sign which read 'Women are Hurt by Abortion' when a young man approached me & said that he wanted to donate some money to the pro life movement, then he reached out his hand & handed me some change.  I counted it out later & it was 92 cents.  How sweet.  It was like the Widow's mite in the Bible.  He said that he will donate more in the future, since now he knows where the pregnancy center is located.  Okay dear Paul.  How touching was this donation, from the heart.

It was 3:30pm & the pro lifers where coming back from E. Main St. to drop off the signs & to go to socialize in the center with some cider & donuts.  It was so good to see all the pro lifers & to spend some time with them.  I was told by one of the ladies that a man from Ethiopia had stopped her to tell her that he worked for the Planned Parenthood Federation in Ethiopia.  He said that he refused to promote abortions & was dismissed.  I met him next door at Mack's store when I returned the coffee container.  I introduced myself to him & brought him over to Focus & had him meet Martha, who was now the only one left.  We spoke with him for awhile & I asked him if he would give his testimony after the Mass that we are having on Wednesday this Wednesday at 6:30pm.  He said "yes".  We exchanged our phone numbers & he left.  I will call him to confirm the date & time.  I do hope that he will be able to come on Wednesday for all the pro lifers to hear hi powerful testimony.  What a day!!  Martha & I then went into the Material Aid Room to put away some children's clothes that I had taken home to wash & brought back to the center.  After that we went to Webster to pick up a double stroller for a client of ours.  I took Martha back home & then went home myself to eat then go to bed for it was a very busy & fruitful day.  Praise God!

 

 Tuesday, October 5, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I was dropping off 2 end tables & a lamp that I purchased at my favorite second hand store at the Focus Center & then I was going to go to the noon Mass downtown.  I asked a strong man, from the taxi company, that we share the building with, to help me get the things out of my car, which he did. As I was leaving the center to go to Mass the doorbell rang & it was one of our clients who is due any day now with her mother.  They came to pick up the car seat that we got for the baby.  I was surprised to see them because I told them I would be there from 1-8pm but this worked out well.  I invited them into the Material Aid Room to pick up some more things for her baby girl, who will soon join us in this world.  Praise God, for this mom was going into Planned Parenthood about 7 months ago, to have an abortion & changed her mind after I showed her the graphic sign Malachi & gave her a Truth packet.  I didn't know that she changed her mind until about 3 weeks ago.  Thank you Lord!  She is the friend of our newest client that had the RU 486 abortion pills taken out of her more than a week ago, that Martha & I brought her to our doctor for the removal, & she told me that her friend had changed her mind.  I told her & her mom to continue to shop & just shut the door when finished for I was heading to go to Mass.  They said "okay" nut first I told them about the racism at Planned Parenthood & gave them some brochures to educate them.  I get the feeling that the girls mom doesn't know that she went to Planned Parenthood to have an abortion that day.  But the outcome is real good that she stayed pregnant & will be delivering her daughter soon.  Yeah!!  This is what it is all about "new life' created by God to be in this world until He call us to go to the next world for all Eternity either to be with Him or to be with the Evil One.  It's your choice!!   

 

Wednesday, October 13, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I arrived at the center & asked for help to unload my car with baby & children items that I was blessed with from the second hand store in East Rochester.  After that I was suppose to go to Webster to pick up a small crib for one of our clients with a small baby girl.  Well that never happened.  I called our client & she couldn't come until tomorrow so I decided to wait until later tonight to pick up the items so I emailed Maria about the change of plans.  The Lord had another plan for this day.  I was expecting Tim to come to set up the bassinet for another one of our clients & to give Martha & I a ham & turkey sub for lunch.  Both came to pass.  I went out to see if the abortionist, Rachael Phelps was there & she was.  As I was walking back to the center & approached a young girl & asked if she needed any assistance.  She said that she needed a pregnancy test so I asked her follow me into the center to get on, she did.  I called to Martha to ask her if she would assist this young lady & she said that she would.  Ironically she knew her from the past.  Tony & Joy who are husband & wife came in to talk to Martha & I for a few minutes & then took some graphic signs & went out to the front lines while I worked at my desk for a few minutes of catch up, but not for long.  The doorbell rang  then Martha had stuck her head into the office to tell me that a couple with 2 children were in the Material Aid Room to get some clothes & she was busy doing a pregnancy test.  No problem Martha.  I got up & went into the Material Aid Room & there was Tony & a woman & a man & 2 young girls around 2 & 3 years old, in a stroller.  Then Tony said to me that she had an appointment at Planned Parenthood on Tuesday, my heart almost dropped.  I turned to her & asked her for what.  She said to me so matter of a fact tone of voice, which ripped my flesh, to have an abortion.  I looked right at her & said "no you're not going to kill your baby".  The man with her said something to her in Spanish, oh no, I thought.  I might not understand Spanish but I certainly can read faces & I didn't like what I saw in his.  I spoke to them both & then he said "it's not my baby".  Lord have Mercy!  I said that it didn't matter whose baby it was that this child was created by God, on loan to you both, to take care of, so work it out.  Martha was finished with the client in the Rose Room so she brought them into the room to speak to them both.  She was with them counseling them for about 15 minutes.  When they came out I continued to speak to them too.  They were given many brochures & DVD's one was the movie Bella & I showed them pictures of aborted babies to which they both reacted to.  I gave them food & diapers for their daughters, from the Material Aid Room & told then that we would help them with their needs.  Martha read to them the poem 'My Life Depends One You, which the mother reacted emotionally.  Then Martha said to the man who still stated that this was not his baby by saying "have you ever made a mistake"?  He bet his head & then the wife said "oh yea you have two other children by another woman & then he said oh yea you have a child in Peru".  What a mess!  Then Martha stated to them, with her hands up, "well then, you're one happy family"!!  As they were leaving I said to the woman that you could die from the abortion for women have, which is a well kept secret.  She just looked at me & they left.  Well, they were given lots of information to ponder.  Please Lord Jesus, please spare this child from being killed, & all the babies that are threatened by abortion, Amen. 

More to come, for we have been so very busy at the Focus Center & on the sidewalk in counseling, in front of Planned Parenthood, in saving lives, though God's grace.   

Saturday, October, 16, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

I was the Team Captain of the 'America Needs Fatima' Rosary Rally, in front of Planned Parenthood, where we are to gather & pray the Rosary to end abortion with all our brothers & sisters in the Nation at 12 noon.  Check out: http://www.americaneedsfatima.org/. The power of people praying all at the same time throughout America & other Countries to end abortion, thus storming Heaven.  While I was still at home I received a call from one of our clients & she was there at the center already to get some diapers & baby clothes.  I told her that we aren't usually open on Saturdays but I was heading there in a little while, & for her to wait for me.  She said that she would.  I had to go to the Post Office first to mail an informational package to a young girl that I met at the gas station on Friday.  While I was getting gas at the corner gas station where I live, I heard a voice  reading my bumper stickers on my car, out loud.  She was saying "You can't be Pro Choice and a Catholic".  I thought, oh no Lord give me the right words to say to her for it's 10:30pm & I'm tired & I don't want to mess this up to witness the Truth to her.  I turned around to speak to her.  I found her not belligerent & defensive but cooperative & pleasant.  She said that she is a Catholic but hasn't gone to church in many years & that she doesn't believe in abortion & is on birth control.  Well, this opens yet another door.  I told her about the abortive effects of the Pill. She said that she didn't know that & turned to her girlfriend, who was sitting in the car, & said to her "did you know that"? She replied that she didn't know that either.  I went to the truck of my car & got for her & her friend a Rosary & our Focus Center's brochure & I saw that I had a booklet on 'How to Examine you Conscious before Confession" & gave it to her.  I said that if I could get her name & address I'd send her our Truth packet & other information to educate her.  She was open & respective to what I was saying which made me feel good.  She got a piece of paper & a pen & wrote it down & gave it to me.  I said "thank you" & that I would send her some information real soon, & if she had any question she could call me at the number that was on the Focus brochure.  She thanked me & we both left the gas station.  I said thank you to the Lord for this 'Divine Encounter' to help someone to come back to the Faith & to get off of birth control & to lead a chaste life.

I went into the center & greeted our mom & her precious baby boy.  I opened up the Material Aid Room for her to go in to shop.  About an half an hour later our clients father arrived to pick her up.  She saw that we had a play seat, for her son, but it was to big for her to take with her now in her fathers car.  She asked if she could pick it up later this evening when her grandmother can pick it up in her van.  I said that I was going to Mass at 4:30 tonight & I'll come back after Mass for her to get it, that would be fine.  She said "thank you very much for that".  "No problem, my dear", I responded back.  Her father & I started to talk & he asked me if I ever went to Corpus Christi Church?  I said "no" & then I asked him if he was Catholic.  He said that he was but hasn't been to Mass in a long time.  I said then you need to go to Confession & then go to Mass every Sunday after that.  He said his grandmother rolled over in her grave.  I said what do you mean?  He said that he had a dream of his Grandmother coming out of the cemetery & approaching him saying "how are you Michael"?  He replied "I'm fine Grandma"  She said back to him "no you are not Michael & I am very disappointed in you" & she started to walk back to the cemetery & he followed her & she turned around & said to him "you cannot follow me where I am going Michael".  He did follow her from a far & saw that she went back to her grave site & laid down & then rolled over. That dream gave me the creeps. He said that dream scared him, to say the least & he wants to go back to church.  I said "by all means come back to the Catholic Church & don't wait till it's to late".  I gave him a brochure of my parish Our Lady of Victory & when the Confession times were & a Rosary to start saying, that the Blessed Mother will draw him back to the church ASAP.  I went to get the America Needs Fatima banner & to speak to Martha who just came in for a few minutes before going outside to start the Rosary.  We thought that it might be only her & I & Rick praying but we were wrong we had a total of 18 people praying right across the street of Planned Parenthood for an hour.  Check out: http://backpew.blogspot.com/. 

There was street work being done, for the workers were putting in new gas pipes on University Ave., for the old ones were worn & dangerous, so cars had to slow down because of the construction work & they saw us praying & had time to read our signs that read 'PRAY TO END ABORTION' & 'WOMEN DO REGRET ABORTION'.  There were only two negative people, one gave us the bird & the other stuck out her tongue.  We continued to pray for them too, otherwise it was a very positive experience.  We also prayed the Divine Mercy prayers & then went into Focus to have some hot chocolate & cookies.  What a nice morning & the weather was great, cool & clear. 

Please ask you son Jesus to end abortion. 
Thanks Blessed Mother.
 

Sunday, October 17th. 2010

Great News!
I just spoke to our mom, in the hospital tonight.  Mother & daughter are doing very well.  Her baby girl was born this evening & weighs 8lbs. 6ozs. & is 22 inches long.  This mom was going into Planned Parenthood, early part of 2010, & she saw the graphic signs & was handed the Truth packet & we spoke with her for awhile, out in the cold.  She went home instead of going into PP for the abortion.  Praise God!!  She's happy & so are we that she 'Chose Life' & her baby does too.  God is happy also.  Amen.... 

 

Tuesday, October 19, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

When I arrived at the center after Mass there were people already waiting to come into the Material Aid Room to get 'free' baby & children clothes & items. Thank God there was Sandy there to help get the things out of my car & Martha's for the center.  A few minutes later there was Donna & the two woman from Hornell which is about 45 minutes away.  Then came Carole & Jerry to be out on the front lines. I needed to get a letter off of the computer to fax it over to the church who wanted the information so that they could put it into their bulletin.  We are scheduled, at the church on October 31st. to receive 10% of the collection money, for Focus.  I pray that the parishioners will be generous to our center's work.  So I scrambled to get the letter printed out & to give it to Elroy, our Accountant, who has his office right next to ours, to fax it over to John who will put it in the bulletin.  Talk about short notice & stress.  I feel like death warmed over but I can't stop & stay home & let this ministry crumble.  The Lord will sustain me & will give me more grace to do the work that He called me to do.  The doorbell just kept on ringing & more moms were in the Material Aid Room to get the things that they needed for their children. 
 
I was in & out of the center & out on the front lines all afternoon.  Cleveland, our street person that we adopted, stopped by & wanted food.  "I'm hungry Mary".  "Okay Cleveland I'll get you something to eat". "Do have any coffee"?  A new request?  I went over to Mack's next door to get him a cup of coffee with 1 teaspoon of sugar & cream.  He liked it a lot.  I hope that I can afford this new request.  It's more expensive then Ramom Noodles. 
 
I was looking out for the husband & wife & their two daughters that came last Thursday to Focus for Material Aid.  She said that she was scheduled for an abortion on Tuesday so I was watching for her.  I really didn't want to see her for if I didn't see her then that meant that she didn't come for the abortion & had changed her mind.  I though that it was clear for it was now 3:30pm & out of Planned Parenthood they all came out one big happy family that was going to kill another member of the family.  This ministry is the hardest & I'm not bragging.  I asked he if she did it & she made it sound that she did then said that she was here for blood work & that her blood pressure was good.  Ick!!  That's all you care about as your baby is secluded to be killed in two days.  Then she said that she was told to come back on Thursday for that's the day that they do abortions.  They do surgical abortions on Thursday & RU 486 abortions on Tuesdays.  How evil!!  I still feel that I'm on the Twilight Zone, for those who can remember it.  Please director, holler "cut, it's a rap you can go home now".   I pleaded with her & her husband was a snot about us talking to her.  Today she referred him as her boyfriend, no mater which he is, he is not the father of this precious baby & he wants this baby DEAD.  Just then Donna M. came by & I engaged her to help me in this situation.  I saw that Martha went over to try to talk to him who was with the two girls in the stroller.  Natasha asked if she could get diapers in the center so Donna & I brought her in.  Donna told her that she would adopt the baby & have an open adoption which meant that if she wanted the baby back she could have him or her back when things got better for her.  I gave her Fr. Tony's phone number for he speaks Spanish & Donna & I gave her our phone number's too to call us.  She wrote all the numbers down on her piece of paper.  She got some diapers & shoes for her children & I gave her my jacket & put in the pockets a Green Scapular, of conversion, & the poem 'My Life Depends on You'.  Oh please dear Lord save this baby & all babies from abortion.  Amen.  She left the center & said that her boyfriend was crazy.  I told her that he didn't love her for he wanted her baby to be killed & what kind of man would want that?  He was across the street at the Gibbs Street Restaurant & he left the two girls in the stroller alone & was walking down the street.  Natasha went over to get her children & Donna & I again asked her not to go for the abortion on Thursday.  I told her that woman do die from abortions which they do.  This is a well kept secret of abortionist & Planned Parenthood.  She said 'thank you" & went with the stroller to catch up to him.  I called out to him one more time before they walked away.  Lord have Mercy!   Donna had to go but said that we should pray & to fast tonight for them.   I agreed.  I said god bye o Donna & went back into the center. 
 
Martha & I did some work in the center & ate supper together talking about the events of the day.  We had a '40 Days for Life' meeting at 7pm but before that we called our clients to tell ten that we had what they had requested from us, like strollers & cribs & bassinets & car seats, to pick up.  They were happy to receive that phone call.  We had a good meeting & were planning the 'Victory Day' on Sunday, October 31st. at 2pm.  Martha & Bill & Pat were sorting out baby clothes & I was working in the office.  I left around 9:30pm.  My heart is heavy to the men & woman who want these baby killed.  How evil, how sick & how selfish too.  They are jeopardizing their souls for eternal damnation too.
 

Wednesday, October 20, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

Martha & I were kept busy in the center for awhile before going out on the front lines.  I stayed in the office longer to do some important paper work leaving Martha by herself for awhile on the front lines which isn't good.  She was by herself then Carole came then I came outside & then Linda came next.  She read the Exorcism prayers & I went into the center to get the Blessed Salt & Holy Water that Fr. Brian blessed a couple of weeks ago at the Mass he celebrated at Focus, he included the Exorcism prayers with the blessings.  Linda sprinkled the Holy Water & Blessed Salt on the sidewalk to come against the evil spirits there at Planned Parenthood, in Jesus' name.  Just as I was walking back to be with the girls the man who works at Planned Parenthood came walking down the sidewalk, he was in front of me.  He's the one that doesn't like the idea that we put our literature box on the wooden edge by the bushes.  He always stops to tell us to take it off & we do then put it right back on again, at times.  Yesterday he got out of his car & came over.  I walked away & asked Carole to go over to him, which she did.  She told him what is more important the things on the ledge or you killing babies in there?  He said to her "so they won't turn out like you".  How evil!  He went in the Planned Parenthood building to do more damage there. How sad.  
 
Kathy came a few minutes later & she handed to me a bunch of 'Voting Pro Life' brochures with a Holy Card of Our Lady of Guadeloupe in it.  We talked & prayed for awhile. She & her husband are moving to Buffalo this month & I will certainly miss them both for they are fantastic people & have blessed the Focus Center with many things over the years.  God bless them in their new move.
 
We had a mother come over to us with her 2 year old son, what a cutie he was.  Martha brought them into the Material Aid Room to get come things for him.  While I was outside I gave Truth packets to 2 girls coming out of Planned Parenthood & after they went back in to get their friend she wanted one too.  I gave them a Growth & Development DVD to watch together & to share with their other friends too.  Prayer & Education are the Keys. 
 
Carole went into her car to get her little dog.  He was a rescue dog that was abused & when she got him he was emaciated.  She & her husband has now bought him back to health & he is so cut & well behaved.  People can be mean.
 
Linda mentioned that there was a web site that we should look at & it is http://www.missysmith2010.com/.  I recommend a WARNING first to look at it.  The Truth is powerful but can be upsetting to say the least.  This woman is making reparation for what she has done in her past so that others will not follow in her footsteps & be harmed by the abortion industry.  Thanks Missy. 
 
Rob came & that was a surprise & then came our birthday boy Bill & after we sang Happy Birthday to him he walked over to the other side of the sidewalk to be with Rob.  Guys like to stick together.  Then Tucker came .  He told me that he ordered a new mega phone for us & we should be getting it real soon.  Yeah & thanks Tuck.
 
Our 3 fantastic Elim Bible Institute Students came at 4pm to help us out at Focus.  They are a tremendous help to me.  I gave them all assignments & they assisted a new mom who just came in for baby clothes in the Material Aid Room which they enjoyed.  Two of the girls made up Truth packets &separated our diapers in plastic bags so that we will have enough for all our moms in need.  One of the girls wrote thank you letters to our benefactors that have blessed us with a monetary gift.  Need less to say I kept them quite busy.  Then Pat our great grandmother, of the babies that were saved from abortion, came in for some baby clothes & to talk about what was going on in her life.  She is going through a lot poor baby.  We love & pray for you dear Pat & don't give up for the Lord is watching over you & your family. 
 
A pro lifer named Pat came in to assist us in the center.  She is trying to get us more diapers through a Huggie Program, through FoodLink.  Thanks Pat. 
 
 
This ministry is based on all the helpers that bless us with their prayers & presence, love & support, emotionally & financially.  I am soooo blessed to know these wonderful people.  Praise you Lord & thank you so much.  We couldn't do it without you dear Lord & the people that you have sent to us. I give all the Glory to God!!!  
 
 

Thursday, October 21, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood

Martha & I got to the front lines at 9:15am today, the weather was miserable, to say the least, it was cold & it rained off & on all day too.  We wanted to be there for all the women who were scheduled for an abortion & also for Nat who was scheduled for an abortion today.  Martha & I spoke to her & her boyfriend on two separate occasions & gave them DVD's on Growth & Development & the Bella movie, also children's clothes & diapers for their 2 daughters.  We showed them pictures & told them that we would help them during the pregnancy & after.  The boyfriend wants this precious baby dead because this baby is not his.  So a baby should be killed if he or she is not yours?  How evil!  If you can't raise this child then place this child up for adoption & give this child a life with parents who will love & care for him or her as their own.  This is not their biological baby either but they want a child.  'The quick kill mentally', how selfish & disturbing.  I told her to say "good bye to the boyfriend & not the baby".  She said that he was crazy, so I rest my case.  Well they never showed up & we were there from 9:15am until 4:30pm & we didn't see them going in or coming out of Planned Parenthood.  Yeah!  But the abortionist killed many babies that day.  The girls were slumped down in the either the front or back seats of the cars driving them out.  One car even had 2 children in it.  They lost a brother or a sister & was brought to the very place, by they parents, that killed him or her.  It's enough to make you sick & it does.  I told the father that he put a curse on his family & killed generations with this abortion.  They just look at you, wait & see!!  We pleaded with the mothers to 'chose life' & that we could help them & that their baby had a heartbeat & deserves a birthday & not a death day.  They deserved to be protected & not harmed.  I call the abortionist & the workers at Planned Parenthood "bullies" & tell them to pick on someone their own size.  It's so evil! 
 
Across the street there was a mom walking her young daughter, who was about 3 years old, down the sidewalk & Martha called to her asking if she would like a 'free' stroller.  She hollered from across the street "yes" & started to cross the street over to where Martha & I were standing by the bushes.  As the young girl was walking she saw the graphic signs & said "oh no" then she saw another picture & said "oh no" & walked over to another & said "oh no", as we were trying to turn the pictures around so she couldn't see them.  The mother was not alarmed that her daughter saw the pictures & followed Martha into the Material Aid Room for clothing.  When she came back out to be with me, for at that time it was just Martha & myself, later on Tony & Joyce & Lynda came to join us, she told me what had happened to this young mother yesterday.  She was walking down on of the inner city street by herself & was jumped by a guy who beat her up & stole her purse with all her ID in it.  When she crossed over the street I didn't see her face for I was looking at the little girls reaction to the signs.  The moms face was cut & she had to go to the Emergency Room for stitches yesterday & was hidden by a hood & scarf.  Martha said that she took the stroller & will come back later on to get the other things that her little girl wanted, she had to go to the police department to fill out some more forms.  Well she kept her promise & came back about 2 hours later, to get the things in the center that she wanted.  As they were coming down the sidewalk the little girl, who was in the stroller, put both of her hands up in the air when she saw Martha.  It was sooo cute & heartwarming to behold.  They went back into the Material Aid Room to finish the deal.  When they came out they walked passed me.  The mom stopped to say hi to me & the little girl saw the mega phone that I was holding & said "I want that".  I looked at her & said "no honey".  Then she said it again "I want that" & pointed to the mega phone that I was holding.  Again I said "no sweetheart, that's not for little girls".  Then she tried to turn around the graphic sign, that I had turned around, so that she couldn't see it.  I thought to myself 'you little dickens'.  Then the mom said in a quiet voice "she tired & needs a nap".  As they were walking away I heard the little girl say in a loud voice "I'M NOT TIRED".   I said to them, "Bye Bye".  In all my years I never met a child so young with such a strong  personality as she had.   She'll keep the mom busy that's for sure.  She was so cute with the bows in her hair & the determined look on her face.  Come to find out that this mother lost her son after heart surgery when he was about 8 momths old & the little girl, who was born before her brothers death, names most of her stuffed animals Michael, after her deceased brother.  How sweet.
 
Tony & Joyce, Martha & Lynda was now on the front lines praying & witnessing.  I saw that a young girl was watching us from across the street at the Veterinary Hospital, probably was talking in all that was happening. Then I saw that she had crossed the street to our side & was talking to Tony & his wife Joyce.  I decided to walk over to them to hear what she was saying & to offer any help that I could.  I will say talking to people one to one is not easy for me especially if they are combative.  I just walk away now rather than argue with them because I found out through my years of experience that you can't.  I went over to her & said "hi can we help you"?  She said "why do you think that by hollering at these people that you are doing any good"?  Wow, okay I will try to talk to her for she asked a question & I will calmly answer her.  I said back to her that more than 50 babies have been saved, through the grace of God, by us being out here hollering at people.  She then said "I don't believe in abortion, only in rape & incest, but is this the best way"?  Then I told her 'My Story' about how I was gang raped & conceived twins & miscarried them & how I grieve them & know that I will see them someday after I die.  I also said that no child should die for the crime of their father & that the mother will suffer even more that she had had an abortion, for that was her fault but the rape wasn't.  She said "is this all you do"?  I said back to her that I was also the director of the Pregnancy Center right next to this yellow building & we offer free pregnancy tests, baby & children clothes, doctors & ultrasound referrals & literature for educational purposes too.  I offered her our Truth packet but she said "no thank you".  I told her that education was very important & the more that you know the more that you can help yourself & others.  Then she said "well Planned Parenthood does good things too, for I went there for birth control".  Now we're cooking.  I said back to her "do you know about the abortive effects of the birth control pills & what they do to you health too, possibly causing breast cancer, heart disease & other health problems too"?  "No" she replied.  I said that Planned Parenthood deceived you & you said that they helped you, see what I mean!!  When you take the Pill you could be aborting 2 pregnancies a year & that you probably have some children in Heaven, so you want to make sure that you don't go to Hell, otherwise you will never be with them for all Eternity. You have to repent of your sins & please do it before it's to late.  She then said "I'll take my chances for I'm not giving up sex".  Sex is not worth going to Hell for I called to her as she was walking back across the street to the Veterinary Hospital.  I hope & pray that some one will come to her to water the seed that was just planed in her soul.  God will not abandon her & He will pursue her.  I pray that I will be better with the one on one when I am challenged & not sound self righteous.  Lord please forgive me of my Pride & male me more of your instrument to speak with holy boldness with love.  Tough love is LOVE & not hatred.  The Truth is hard to accept & some don't accept it readily but hopeful in time they will. "You shall know the Truth and the Truth shall set you free" but first it will make you miserable :(  
I waited for her to come back out of the Vets to tell her to check out this web site for information but I must have missed her.  I felt badly that she didn't take the Truth packet but know that the seed of Truth was planted in her heart, by what I said to her.  Now it's up to her & her 'free will'.  Lord have Mercy!  Her & everyone that I talk to is planted in my heart, maybe that's way I hurt so much. 
 
Great News!  A mom, who had called me for some boy clothes for her baby, who is due November 15th., told me that she had changed her mind, to have an abortion, because we were out in front of Planned Parenthood showing her the pictures & talking to her.  This was exciting news to hear.  Then on Thursday I received a phone call from a young girl, that needed  clothes for her baby, that will be born next month too.  She said that it was because we were out, in front of Planned Parenthood, that she changed her mind about having an abortion that day.  This was great news to hear again.  Praise God!!
 
 
 
Friday October,24, 2010 in my world
 
I went to a funeral Mass for my dear friend Mary Ann's mother who died at Monroe Community Hospital for the Mass at 11am.  It was a beautiful Mass with the celebrant Fr. Dennis Bonsonori, who is related to my sister's husband, a distant relative but a powerful on to say the least. After the Mass  I went to Beth, Bath & Beyond to return my sleep mask for another, they work very well in keeping out the sunlight, when the cashier spotted my '40 Days for Life' pin that I was wearing.  She said "I like your pin & I don't believe in abortion but my girlfriend's mother made her have one just a couple of days ago".  My heart sank.  She went on to say that she offered to adopt the baby but the mother wanted non of that.  I asked how old the friend was & she said 18.  I asked why she couldn't have run away to a safe house.  She said that her mother followed her everywhere she went.  What power she has over her daughter.  I said that I was the director of the Focus Pregnancy Help Center & gave her my card & told her if she or her girlfriend needed any help just please call me .  I said for her to watch out for some complications of having had an abortion & she said that she was suicidal before the abortion.  I said for her to watch her closely for that is one of the complications from having had an abortion.  Just then my cell phone rang & it was one of our clients saying that she was heading over to the center to pick up the items that I had promised her.  Unplanned, for I had just gone grocery shopping & needed to go to the bank to deposit the checks that the center had received over the past week, into the bank.  I hadn't planned on this but this was the only time that she could get her friends van to pick up all the things which included a bassinet, Pac n Play & a car seat.  So I go with the flow & said my good bye to the sorrowful cashier to which I felt her pain & off to the center I go with my milk & cheese, in a bag, in the back seat of my car.  All will work out, it always does.  My heart went out to the young girl whose heart was crushed by her girlfriends abortion forced by the mother, who will be held more accountable than the daughter, for the murder of this precious child. 
 
I got to the center to meet our client who had changed her mind of having an abortion because we were out there in front of Planned Parenthood to educate her to what abortion was all about.  She went home that day after choosing life.  Yeah!  She was a sweet young girl with a huge smile.  We said hi & she told me that I had beautiful hair.  I said that her hair was beautiful too.  We got help form the guys at the taxi company & Mack from next door to put the things in the van.  The driver of the van was handicapped & couldn't help & I couldn't help due to my nerve root compression at L5 injury, which the abortionist Morris Wortman caused back in 1978. I also have my current challenge Fibromyalgia too, that's not including the gross abdominal pain that I suffer every day of my life.  What a mess I am.  She was so happy that everything fitted in the van & I thanked the driver for taking such good care of our girl & gave her a hug & off they went.  Her baby is due in the middle of November & we'll get some baby boy clothes for him before that. 
 
I thanked the guys for helping us & off to East Rochester I go to put the groceries away before our meeting at 3:30 at Starbuck's at the 12 corners in Brighton.  I got there in a hurry. Pat, our Monday evening counselor, & two lovely ladies from the Angel Ministry, where they make dresses for women in need all over the world, were waiting for me.  We met to see how our two ministries could help each other, in helping our clients, live a better life.  They were so interesting & ironically we knew the same people.  They go to St. Cecilia's Parish & Fr. Leone there is my & the Focus Center's Spiritual Director & the other priest there burns our DVD's that we give out to our clients to save lives.  They know Muriel, who is a wonderful prayer warrior & has a ministry, of prayer.  It was a blessed afternoon to be with all these fine women. 
 
Tuesday, October 26, 2010 in front of Planned Parenthood
 
What a day!!  I knew Martha wasn't going to be there & warned Donna about that.  She was great for she came into the center to help me with ALL the mothers that came in with their children to get baby & children's clothes.  It all started when I arrived at the center & I ended up speaking with two pro lifers who are suffering at the news that their 3 year old grandson is suffering with cancer & is going through many treatments that are difficult for the child & for the family.  They gave a generous donation to the work at the Focus Center, how generous & loving.  My heart & prayers go out to them & their family.  Lord please heal this precious little boy & thank you.  Then they went to the front lines to pray & I went into the center.  All of a sudden the doorbell rang, rang & rang again.  So many mothers came into the Material Ad Room for clothes & small items.  I also received a call from a mom who was in need of diapers & formula & her husband came in later on to get the items.  He also took a Rosary for her & for him.  His wife is Catholic & will have their baby Baptized real soon.  This is great news!!  I am so happy that we are there for our moms in a short time duration until things get better for them in a longer duration.  There was 7 pro lifers out on the front lines while Donna & I were manning the center.  We were also putting away the donations that we received from good people. 
 
I went into the Great Room to eat a quick sandwich & the doorbell rang & I was called out to come to talk to a young girl.  I lead her into the Rose Room & we started to talk. She told me about her friend who is pregnant with triplets who might be aborting on Thursday.  She was lead into the center by Susan & I was talking to her about birth control then I started to talk about abortion & she told me that her girlfriend is pregnant with triplets but her mother said that there was enough children in the house already.  Then she said that her girlfriend was at Planned Parenthood now & she was suppose to meet her there & get her birth control patch!! Check out: http://www.lifesitenews.com/ldn/2005/jul/05072703.html  "What" I said !  I started to give her everything that I had on abortion & adoption & told her that she will be the 'life saver' of these 3 little babies & that we will pray for her & here is my phone # if you need me for anything.  Off she went to Planned Parenthood hopefully she will be used by God to save these precious babies from being killed on the abortion day.... Thursdays.  My prayers go out to this situation & hope that this mother chooses life for her 3 children.  Life is cheap at Planned Parenthood! 
 
I went out to the front lines for the first time all day to give the team more packets of Truth packets.  When I arrived there was a car that came out of the parking lot & Susan offered them the packet of information.  The passenger started to ask some questions & I asked the driver to come along the side of the sidewalk near us.  They saw the graphic pictures & started to ask some questions.  One question was "what if the girl can't afford the baby"?  So I said "that's no reason to kill a baby, there is NO reason, abortion is always evil".  Then Susan told them that Planned Parenthood was Racist.  I said that there was a lot of information in the packet that you just took.  Then he said "what about birth control"?  I told them about the abortion effect of birth control & that sex outside of marriage is a serious sin & must be confessed.  The right way that pleases the Lord is to get married first then have sex & your children, any other way is a great offense to the dear Lord.  The man said "keep up the good work that your all are doing".  We all said "thank you" & they drove away.  Just then I heard a voce saying to me "are you Mary"?  I said "yes".  She said that she had brought some blankets for the moms &  said why don't you follow mew into the center.  We walked & talked at the same time.  I brought her into the center & gave her a tour, she was impressed.  She then asked me about why I thought birth control was wrong.  I told her & she thanked me for the information which she didn't know about.  Education & prayer are the keys.  She wrote us a check to help us in the work that we do at Focus.  She also gave us some baby clothes & some beautiful blankets for our babies.  Thank you so very much for blessing us Suzanne, please come again. 
 
The doorbell rang again & it was three adults & two small children.  I asked Donna if she could assist them in the Material Aid Room.  All of a sudden by what they were saying I realized that they were the family that 'chose life' about a year ago.  Here is the story told by Tony:  We were wrapping things up at Planned Parenthood and were putting the signs away (by this time it was pretty much Joyce and I) and this women comes out of the vet hospital across the street from the focus center.
